reviews.review: Good serene. This was a serene and peaceful place to visit. We went early in the morning and spent good time near the Buddhha statue.

Interesting. Did a day tour of Lantau Island. It included the Big Buddha, Monestary, Cable Car and Tai O village. Was that an eye opener. All in all, thoroughly enjoyed the tour and would recommend going to this island whether on your own or part of a group.
Worth the daytrip. Really quaint fishing villages, and the big buddha is a top attraction. It's worth a day trip if you have the time.

So Peaceful and nice.. My only experience with this is rushing up the peak for sunset and rushing down to catch the last bus back to main land. It was beautiful though and i would recommend staying there for at least a night or two. The foods kept their originality of home cooked and its definitely not to be missed!

Nice place to visit. We went here on a very hot day. That was the only downfall. We took the cable ride and it was well worth the effort. We bought the express tickets with the glass bottom and we were glad we did. We avoided all the lines. This is a long cable ride.Enjoy it.There are restaurants there also but nothing above tourist type stuff. The Buddha was great. I highly recommend that you take this trip when in Hong Kong.

Fantastic cultural day. We travelled with Buffalo Tours to Lantau Island as a day trip. This day was the highlight of our stay in Hong Kong. We visited a fishing village, the Budda, vegan lunch (which was delicious) and the cable car back. This is a MUST DO when you travel to Hong Kong.

Travel for the big Buddha. It is located near Tung Chung MTR station and the cable car is connected between Tung Chung and big Buddha. In my opinion, most convenient way to the Buddha and to see the harbor and city view of Hong Kong. Suggest tourists to book a ticket early in case avoiding a long queue to buy a ticket of cable car.

Delightful. A very enjoyable place to visit. The trip by MTR is easy. The cable way to the Buddha statue is very well organised. The fishing village of Tai O is also worth a visit with excellent street food.

MTR to Tung Chung. It is easy to get to Lantau Island by the MTR to Tung Chung. You can get off before then for Disneyland if that is your thing. I went there to catch the gondola to Ngon Ping 360 Village.

Tropical Vacation. We stayed at Silvermine Beach for 3 days and it was the perfect way to relax after the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong. Nice sandy beach, decent water quality. Lots of municipal reconstruction of waterfront. Good seafood restaurants. Walk to hotels from ferry/bus terminal. Loads of recreational hiking here.
well worth the visit. Take the ferry from Central at Hong Kong island, it only takes 30 minutes and costs less than £5. Then take the bus from the harbour to visit the temple and the big buddha.

Enjoyed our visit. We booked a cultural tour to go to Lantau Island.You can catch the train from Kowloon to get there. We started off with a 25min cable car ride that showed fantastic views of the surrounding country side plus the airport. We arrived at the destination and met our guide Ross who took us to a tea making demonstration where they show you the correct was to make tea and especially bloom tea. We were able to sample these teas before going on a short bus ride to Tai O fishing village where our guide showed us through the market explaining about the different typed of dried fish they were selling. We then went on a boat ride where we saw how the locals lived in houses on stilts over the water, followed by a fun boat ride into the sea to see if we could spot the pink dolphins. We had no luck that day but the boat ride was fun and we did see a number of flying fish. After our boat trip we were free to wander around the village and I bought some almond biscuits from the bakery. Then back on the bus to go to see the big Buddha that is made out of bronze and it sits on a hill and if you have the energy you can climb to the top for a closer look. We then went to the Po Lin Monastery which is only a short walk from the Buddha. It is very beautiful and the atmosphere is very serene.They are noted for their vegetarian food but if that is not your thing there are other food outlets plus shops where you catch the cable cars. I thoroughly enjoyed our tour and the cable car ride.

Great place - even in the rain!. Lantau Island is beautiful. The transportation (buses) on the island are not for the faint of heart. The Big Buddha and monastery were magical despite the heavy rains that day. The Tai O Fishing village was amazing, so many sights and smells. Lunch at the Tai O Heritage Hotel was delicious (their onion soup was off the charts delicious)
Good. This is pretty good and the place is ideal for people wanting a day out. You can enjoy out here if it's sunny.

A Must See Experience. It can be easy to get lost in the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong but some time on Lantau will help you find the peace and quiet you need. Be it the Big Buddha or Tai O, The area is stunning and something that will stick in your mind long after you leave.

Definitely go for the rope-way!. Loved our rope-way trip across this island.. since we had pre-booked tickets online, had relatively easier access to board the cable cars. Beware of crowds on the weekends!But the views from the top were totally worth the wait... fabulous experience, at one point our cable car was completely surrounded by clouds.. surreal experience! Don't miss it!

Solo traveler approved, no tour needed. Whether you are a solo traveler as I was or traveling with family, Lantau Island is something everyone should experience while visiting Hong Kong. Despite the numerous ads for tour operators, this was one of the easiest experiences I had in Hong Kong. From the Crystal Cabin (glass bottom cable car) to Tian Tan Buddha to Po Lin Monastery, it was completely accessible and easy to navigate on my own. Using the MTR app for iPhone, I navigated my way from Jordan MTR to Lantau Island in less than 40 minutes. My recommendation, take the cable car round trip but arrive early on a weekday. At 9am with Starbucks in hand (there's one less than 3 minute walk from Ngong Ping gates) I was first in line. Many places will say buy tickets in advance, I had no issue getting my tickets the day of. The Crystal Cabin has much shorter lines, and the views thru the glass bottom are spectacular. Separate review under Ngong Ping experience.You can make Lantau Island a three hour visit or full day depending on your objectives. Tian Tan Buddha, Po Lin Monastery and walking amongst the various storefronts was accomplished solo in 4 hours. When I left in early afternoon, the lines were similar to any major theme park to get tickets / cable cars. There is so much to see, from lush mountain tops, hidden trails and waterfalls to nearby HKG actively ushering people to and from Hong Kong. I have zero regrets spending part of my 72 hours here, and I would do it again.
Beautiful island. Very lush island. I didn't have enough time to explore here but my over all experience was great. Big Buddha is a must as well as the cable cars.

Very exciting trip with the glass botton cable car. I went to Lantau island and took the cable car to go to the giant sitting Buddha. My personal advice is te select the Glass bottom cable car. The view from the cablecar is breathtaking as you fly hundreds of meters above the sea and if you have the glass bottom if feels like flying!

Scenic island. What a scenic island! We took the ferry from HK Island and after 25 mins you arrive at the island. As we did the reverse route we took first the bus (23) to Tai O Fishing Village and had a great lunch there. From Tai O we took a taxi ($ 52) to Bus to Ngong Ping Village with the Giant Buddha, Poh Lin Monastery. If you are at the Ngong Ping Village you may want to walk the Wisdom Path. 15 Mins and you have a great view of the reservoir and the mountains. Back to Tung Chung Station by Cable Car. Note: we took the cable car at 5.30pm and had to wait almost an hour before we could go. The waiting time is very long.
Great time. Spent the day there, enjoyed it very much, the giant Buddha is huge. Enjoyed the tram ride . If your in Hong Kong, would recommend seeing

Great place to stay or visit. I was worried we would be too removed from the bustle of Hong Kong by staying on the island. I was right but it was a blessing. We found plenty to do on and off island. The public transport made life easy. It was green and attractive and I was pleased to come home at the end of the day to the T Hotel to relax.

When you want to escape the highrise in City. Not much going on at Lantau, except from the airport, and that is the good thing. Ok, Disney is also here. Tai O is a small fishing village where things could not be more different from Kowloon and central. So different from the busy City, with a lot of small villages you can discover. The small village Mui Wo is worth a visit, if you want to escape the rush. Surrounded by mountains, just the busride is beautiful. From MuiWo, you can also take the ferry to or from Discovery Bay and relax at the beach, have a dinner at the oceanfront restaurants or continue with the fast ferry directly to Central. From Tung Chung, you can take the cable car up the mountain and end up at the big Buddha. You can also walk up there, if you want a bit more exercise. There is a trail following the cable car, with a stunning view of the Airport. You will have to be in good shape, from Tung Chung it will take more than 2 hours uphill walking. All around Lantau, you will find really good walking trails. Fung Wong Shan, called Lantau Peak, is the highest point on Lantau, with 934 meters.
Nice ride. Very beautiful view, nice place, worth going. You can have half day trip on way to air port. Nice place

Wonderful Cable Car journey . They journey by NgongPing360 cable car itself is a reason to go.With wonderful views all around of the HK airport and the valleys, it is quite a long cablecar journey.On the island itself there are plenty of things to see and do, the Big Buddha, Polin Monastery and plenty of food and shopping opportunities. One can have a nice time there, seemed popular with the locals too.
Meh. Not worth all the lines and the hype. We took the crystal carriage. I think we would have been happier doing the hike. That looked really fun and pretty from the tram.

Beautiful island.. Lantau is an island almost as big as entirety of HK. It is right next to the airport, and it seems like it is a lovely hike from the city over to the Po Lin Monastery/Buddha. We were lazy so we gondola'd, but a green you don't get to see too much these days.

Worth every penny ,highlight of the trip. Recommend you take a day out for this The set menu at the venue was excellent (vegetarian only)not being a great lover of heights ,my wife cohersed me into the cable car in leu of other treats ,the view travelling back is breathtaking with views if the airport and the bridge under construction to Macau.

Scenic visit. . The cable car ride is great. The view is spectacular. On the island, there are several walks available in addition to numerous shops around the Big Buddha area. To walk the steps to the Buddha requires a bit of energy!

Day Trip. Do it like this: Head there early (like leave Kowloon or Causeway bay by 8am). Take the 360 up to Ngong Ping as soon as it opens. If not, you won't, because the line will get 2 hours long by 10am. Buy a one way trip and don't waste money on any packages. You can spend a few more dollars for the crystal cabin, but it's just a glass floor and not that exciting. At the top, walk through the village and don't overpay for stuff here. It is very commercialized and corporate so no haggling. Go to Buddha and don't buy meal plan. Get free bottle of water and ice cream at the top before you head back down. Walk through Po Lin and circle back to the bus depot. Take bus (15 minute air conditioned ride that is clean and comfortable) to Tai O fishing village. Jump on a junk boat and see the stilt houses at low tide hopefully and possibly see the white dolphins in the bay (we saw 2). Then after the 20 minute boat ride, walk the village streets and eat at one or more of the local street food vendors. The Giant Fish Ball place was my favorite. Grab a beer to walk with. then, head back to the bus terminal and go back to the Lantau terminal (25 minutes on bus) and head back to your hotel. Plan for 5 hours at least but no more than 6.5 including transit. Perfect day trip!

Surprisingly enjoyable . We did buy tickets online and after catching the MTR we walked up and bypassed the queues and would have saved at least 20-30 minutes. We purchased the crystal cabin which means it has a see through floor which was great as you get to quite a height. Ngong Ping village was surprisingly enjoyable. Ensure you sign up for the 5D cinema as that was great fun. The Buddha film was worth a look as well. Some of the shops had items that we had not seen anywhere else in HK and some of the stores had some very good bargains. The Po Lin Temple had such intricate designs on the building and were beautiful inside. The Big Buddha was a decent climb up the stairs but the view was worth it. Just make sure you go to the back to see the views behind of the rest of the island and the surrounding bays and islands.

I love Lantau island. Well worth a visit there is plenty to do and see here I usually stay with friends There are some lovely treks and walks some lovely places to visit for example the big Buddha and Tia O which is an old fishing village where you can take a short boat ride to hopefully see the famous white dolphins it's best chance to see the dolphins is before mid morning however I even if you don't get to see the dolphins the boat ride is well worth it
Relax faraway from the city centre. Lantau island is a good place to have fun in Disneyland or relax in Ngong ping village and see the big buddah and chinese monastery.The airport is there too.

Amazing views and very relaxing. This is a great trip, buy your tickets before hand as the queues are very long this certainly made the process easier. The ride is great and the scenery excellent. Once there be prepared for a steep walk up to the Big Buddha but again well worth the effort!!
awesome island. So many beautiful spots, sceneries and varieties of views. very nice islands to be into for sometime.

Amazing views! . Worth the wait in line to get there. You can purchase tickets ahead of time but it didn't seem to save a ton of time (just my opinion as they separate the lines). We did the standard cable car up and the views were really beautiful. It is definately better on the side looking up towards the mountain as the people facing down have to crane their necks to look as you can't really stand as you then block other ppls view.
Airiel tram offers fantastic views. Taking tram to BIG Buddha was exciting and offered great view of island and airport. Reasonable price, seemed safe, took ferry back, all around good half day trip.

Go early and beat the lines. Lantau is definitely worth a trip out, but plan ahead to get the best experience. You can purchase the cable car tickets ahead of time, which you should definitely do to avoid the lines. We went early and were the first ones out when everything opened. Things get crowded pretty quickly, especially on the weekends. We were shocked by how long the line was on our way back! The area right after you arrive is super touristy, although I can't say we didn't appreciate the Starbucks. Seeing the Buddha (and climbing the 268 steps to see Buddha's view) is worth all the hassle though. Check out the monastery with its beautiful carvings and color while you're at it. If you're up for amazing vegetarian food, get meal tickets for lunch at the monastery.
Loved the cable cars!. You can not miss riding the cable cars when in HK. Took it up to see the big Buddha and back down. Pay to ride in the glass bottom cars!

Lantau island. One of the best places to be visited in Hong Kong.There are no wild monkeys and there is good beach to sweem.You can reach the island by ferry, walk along the island through the swimming area about 2-3 hours and get back ferry to Hong Kong.

A great escape from HK activity. A paradise for runners or hikers.
Went there a few times for the visit of the big Buddha, but also to go hiking. So many natural places to discover ... Enjoy !

a visit to big budda. catching the cable car to Big Budda was the best way to get there and have the opportunity to see the island. We caught the bus down to have the opportunity to see more of the island. Take a hat with you as it does get hot.

With the big Buddha, Tai O, and the busses--definitely worth the trip. Lantau is easy to get to on the subway, which dumps you off right at the cable car that takes you to the big Buddha. From their you can take a bus to Tai O, which is also definitely worth a visit. From Tai O, a bus runs every 15 min to take you back to the subway and your starting point. Very easy to do from HK or Kowloon, and very worth the time.
Enjoyed the bit we did.. Only used the cable car and the Buddha but really enjoyed it. The other aspects looked well run but weren't our cup of tea.

Needs quite a lot of time. I think this would be a better experience with some planning. I took the fast ferry from Central, which costs just under HK$30 and takes half an hour. Not a particularly scenic journey. There are a couple of nice beaches near the ferry terminal and it was very quiet on a Friday. I walked up the well marked path to the waterfall and the old silver mine. Very steep uphill climb and debatable as to whether it was worth it but certainly nice to get out of the city. I could have spent a few more hours walking the heritage trail but decided against. Couldn't find anywhere to eat that looked appetising. There are, I believe, some good hiking trails on the island and a bus trip might have been a good idea but walking distance from the fast ferry? I'd look at another option another time.

Just you average terminal with over priced outlets. The cable car terminal to big buddha is here. You can see the airport from the cable cars. That is if the pollution allows you to. The shopping out let is a misnomer. The idea of an outlet is to give real discounts. The concept is American. But that is where this end. You will pay thtough the nose ,nothing like the outlets in US.

Amazing place . Well you would actaully pass the island on your way to big Buddha. The best transportation way is Crystal Cabin. Make sure to download the Audio before going up and enjoy ut. Its 25min and explains the whole way there. You will enjoy the sight seeing and it would give you a whole review about it.
good scenery. it's good to try this cable car. i took the cristal cable car, where we can see the forest and sea under our feet. must must must try....!!!!!!! a pleasant experience
Crystal cabin. Spent a lovely morning travelling up to The Big Buddha on the Crysal Gondola, well worth the money, we were lucky we had a lovely sunny day
Lovely views. Beautiful views but not for people who dislike heights. You may walk it back but it is a very long journey.
Fun cable car ride to see Big Budda. Very fun cable car ride - We were lucky only a few people in ours and you can see all around and quite lovely. Comfortable and felt safe

Hit the jackpot with ngong ping 360. Headed to Lantau island from Airport on local bus. 10 mins and AU$1.50 rtn. Arrived @cable car to see a seemingly endless queue ahead when I hit the jackpot! Tour guide offering package deal with cable car, guided bus tour, boat ride, fishing village visit and the bonus fast track lane both ways for only twice cost of just cable car. ($68 instead of $34) Saved myself total of 2 precious hours and of standing in humid unpleasant conditions) . Fantastic ride across the mountain and trip in island , seeing local culture and monastery, Buddha is a must see. From airport and back to airport you need at least 3-4 hours. Can stay longer if you have time to soak in the local atmosphere .You can shop also at outlets if you need that last minute brand piece! Thanks ngong ping360 and guides for a truly memorable day ! You can also buy the trip on tour from HK for about $180!! Just take the train yourself from HK ( or bus from airport) and save yourself a bundle and manage your own time.

Nice cable car ride...through the clouds. It was a long walk until we reached the start of the cable car ride to Lantau Island. The weather was perfect and the cable car went right through the clouds. It was very scenic.

A Must Visit. Visiting Lantau Island on our second visit to HongKong after more than 20 years was the best decision we made for our short vacation here this time. We took the crystal cabin cable car ride (180 HKD one-way but frankly you don't lose out much if you decide on the cheaper standard cabin) from the Nong Ping 360 terminal next to Tung Chung MTR station. We bought our cable car tickets from a travel agent to avoid the queue as there is a separate line for that and went there early at 9am, time the rides open on weekends.  It was quite mystical as the cable car comes up to the Nong Ping village and the majestic Big Buddha loomed in the distance. We didn't care much for the shops in the village as it's all very commercial and headed straight for the Big Buddha and the Po Lin monastery. Worth the experience to climb the 200-odd steps up to the bronze statue. The temples in the monastery are quite impressive too.  From Nong Ping village we took Bus #21 to Tai O village. The fare is only 6.6 HKD and took only 20 mins but make sure to check the bus schedule by the bus shelter so you can be there early to ensure you get on as it is a one-hour interval between buses.  From Tai O we took Bus 1 to Mui Wo to catch the ferry to Central MTR station. The bus ride is about 50 mins and the ferry ride (choose the faster ferry) took only 30 mins. Make sure to check the ferry times before you sit down for lunch at the Mui Wo cooked food market.

Perfect day trip from Hong Kong. Fun cable car ride up to the mountain, breathtaking views, gigantic Statue of Buddha (I think one of the largest in the world). Loads of great hiking and nature trails. Go early in the morning to avoid the rush

An unexpected delight!. This was one of the things we (me, husband & 3 yo daughter) had on our list of things to do when visiting Hong Kong, but it wasn't a high priority. However, it turned out to be one of our favourite activities of our trip.We booked our tickets in advance online and I am so pleased we did. When we arrived there was a HUGE queue for people buying tickets, it must have been at least an hour long. Because we had bought tickets in advance we strolled to a queue with about 6 people in it. Once you've bought your ticket you then need to join another queue to board the cable car.We opted for a standard cable car rather than the one with the glass bottom. Another winning decision as the queue for the glass bottom was huge and more expensive with less cable cars.The trip in the cable car is stunning with amazing views. When you get close to the top, the Big Buddha on top of the hill comes into view for the first time and it is really impressive. There is a really nice little village at the top although quite commercialised with Starbucks and Subway etc. We walked through the village towards the Buddha and climbed the steps up to the top. It was hard works and the heat didn't help but well worth it when we got to the top.I really loved this day trip out and was definitely a highlight for all of us.

Fascinating buddha. The big Buddha is the most important thing hereThe Ning ping ropeway was awesome The scenery is breathtakingly beautiful On a clear day you can see China and Macau alsoA must visit place in Hong Kong
Great glimpse of older times. Great to see the cultural heritage, good day visit activity, not too expensive.The views are great, good family activity. A few people walk to the big Buddha.

Best beaches in the area. Public transportation available.. Went by ferry then bus to beach. Not crowded when we went but cannot guarantee that is always the case. You can take a small barbecue and grill on the beach. Had a relaxing day during a whirlwind touring experience.

Great place to visit. The key feature of visiting the Lantau islands it the transport - ropeway rides,(one way or both ways) and/ ferry. One can go by ropeway and come back by ferry. The Buddha statue is huge and approach by ropeway provides great visuals of the statue on top of the hill. The food ticket bought in the food court before climbing to the Buddha statue gets you an entry to the inside chamber.Overall, a great tourist spot and overall experience.

Must vist place highest cable car in Hongkong. The place is accessible through the Tung Chung MRT station. Its like 5 min walk to the cable car station. We had booked the tickets through Klook app which was very convenient. The cable car is a 25 min ride to the top. You can choose between the glass bottom or standard cabin. We had chosen Standard as my husband is scared of heights.You can see the airport from the cable car and the Hongkong city. Better to go in the morning as you can easily spend the day there. You have the fishing village, big Buddha and monastery to see. You also get Indian food there, which was delicious.

Good cable car ride, amazing views,. The cable car ride was thoughrly enjoyable , the views from the car where great, the Giant Buddha and the monastery were breaking and certainly the real highlight of the trip for us, recommended
A must see!!. This was def on our list of things to do....don't pay for a taxi unless you really want to> We did and ended paying ~210 HKD ....the MTR is right there, we took it back & paid 36 HKD
The cable car is well worth doing. If you are planning to go to Lantau Island via the cable car try to avoid the weekend, as there were long waits to buy tickets and for the return journey

Beautiful and peaceful place. In your visit to lantau island don't miss the chance to take the cable car to the big Buddha. There u can find a bus station with buses running until late night to go back (if u don't wanna take the cable car which has the last one at 6pm) in the same bus terminal I also advice to take a bus to go to "Tai O" an old and really cool fisher's village. It was the best day during my stay in Hong Kong.

filed with agventure. this is one of the thrilling experience you can get in Hong kong. This is not recommended for people with fear of heights. during the windy times in the middle of the tour you will be very exited

Giant Buddha of Lantau Island. This is a great get away from the Hong Kong Hustle & Bustle. I wanted to visit the "Giant Buddha" of Lantau Island for some time, finally had the chance. Usually a sky tram takes you to the Ngong Ping Pateau where the Buddha is located, BUT, it was down for service when I was there so a 45min hair raising bus ride was the order of the day. Hair raising ride because the Bus drivers know the route like the back of there hands, very narrow, windy road, forest on one side, beach front on the other with Water Buffalo walking around every where! Once at the Po Lin Monastery it is a very surreal and semi spiritual experience, at least for me. There is much to see besides the 85 foot Buddha. The monastery buildings are so ornate you can spend hours looking at all the intricate details inside & out (like at the "Grand Hall of Ten Thousand Buddhas"). 260 or so steps up to see the Buddha, and it will most likely be hot & humid, drink lots of water before you start the climb, be careful of people stopping in front of you to take selfies, it happens a lot. The Buddha is stunning as is the view. This was one of the high lights of my trip. It can be touristy but with sereneness of the monastery, on going incense burning for the departed, Sculptures & art, it is an amazing place.

easy to get round by local buses. Take the ferry from Central ferry pier to Miu Wo. From here get a bus to Tai O. If you are over 65 ask for a Senior ticket which is half price. Have a look around the fishing village and do the boat trip to try to spot the pink dolphins. Then take a bus to Tung Chung and after wandering around there take the cable car to Po Lin and the Big Buddha. If it's raining and visibility is poor get a bus from Tai O direct to the Big Buddha. The shopping village next to the bus depot is worth a look. From here get the bus back to Miu Wo for the ferry back to the mainland

The largest outlying island. Lantau Island is large in size with many places worth to spend days therer if you have more time to visit Hong Kong. You can plan to visit different areas and locations on a few days. For example, you can take a ferry from the pier at Central of Hong Kong to Sivermine Bay, Cheung Sha and Pui O; another day by MTR to Tung Chung and Tai O; another day to walk up or around the mountain trail there.

Nice day outing from HK. If u have a day to spare do visit. The big Buddha and tai o fishing village is a refreshing getaway from the hustle and bustle of HK.. take the 25 min cable car ride.its worth it..

If you have extra days go. Big Buda beaches Disneyland and airport. A bit off the path but not far.
Not a place to go if you only have 1 or 2 days in HK. But ok to squeeze it. Note don't go in the rain or clouds. Easy sub way with one switch on line from Kowloon. Easy with driver too .
Amazing Ropeway!. A must visit. Rope way is among top 5 in world if I am not wrong. The whole duration of half an hour is thrilling! Wonderful view throughout.We clicked lots of pictures.

Lantau island . We visited Lantau island on a day tour. It was a fun experience and the island is so very different from Hong Kong. Quiet, peaceful beaches, no traffic, lots of farming land and fishing villages. A different side of Hong Kong and well worth a visit. Try to go on a tour as there is only local transport on the island. Don't think there was any buses but there was taxis if you can cope the cost.

Great views! Food was just okay.. Buy the tickets in advance! You'll save a lot of time since the lines are generally long. I recall the ride to the island was about 20 minutes and comfortable. I liked the souvenir shops.

A must visit to the Big Buddha. It is very easy to get to Lantau from Hong Kong by the MTR The cable car across to the Big Buddha is a must as you get such a great view of the island and also the Airport which shows just how big it is, you can also see from the cars when you are going up the new bridge out over the ocean that is being constructed.We took the normal cable car, but if you wish to pay extra you can take the car with the glass floor and look down as well as out.You need to get there early on the weekends as there are lots of people all waiting to go to see the Big Buddha and each car will only hold 8 people.The shopping mall at Lantau has many outlet shops as well as places to eat, the outlet shops have well know brands and worth looking at as we found many items at prices better than back in the shopping centres of TST in Hong Kong.To go to Lantau and see the Big Buddha and do shopping you need to allow the whole day by the time you get back to Hong Kong it will be late afternoon, if you start early in the morning.

best way to travel in hong kong. the cable car journey to the island was very good and suitable for all families it took us to the island in 45mins i would advise you to take the cable car which has the glass see through at the bottom
Great Sight. The sea bridge connecting Lantau with Kawloon is superb. Lantau is very green and gives you a feel of a hill station.

Absolutely beautiful!. Take a metro from the Hong Kong city and get down at the last station, and then get to the cable car station. And then the fun begins. The cable car will take you to the beautiful ngong ping 360 village. For someone like me, who has never visited china, the village gave me a good sense of Chinese culture and people. Not to forget, the big buddha is magnificent.

This Destination is a Must. Available by 1/2hr ferry ride from Hong Kong Central Pier or by car via Kowloon, this otherworldly island, an incredible contrast to these nearby urban areas, offers so many grand elements. The pun is intended because here is where you'll see the "grand" Giant Buddha who is a true wonder to behold. But, there is also the Tai O Fishing Village with its houses on stilts, the Po Lin Monastery (don't miss the incredible vegetarian meal), the Ngong Ping Village (although quite commercialized and best, in my opinion, to be used only as the most straightforward route to the cable car), and the thrilling cable car ride back down to civilization. Don't miss this!

Spectacular giant buddha. Great day trip from Hong Kong. Cable car ride to the monastery & statue was a great way to get a view over the harbour & waterways as well as the mountainside itself. The statue is impressive & worth the long climb to the top. The temple is awesome as well, impressive in its elaborate decorations & painting as well as the buddhas.

Make time to see this incredible island. We spent 2 days battling the crowds in both Hong Kong and Kowloon. We were ready to get out of the city and maybe see a little bit of China outside of the big city. A visit to Lantau island was just what we needed. We stayed at the Novotel Citygate hotel in Tung Chung which proved to be an excellent base of operations. From there, we took the cable car to Ngong Pong village and a visit to the Big (Tian Tan) Buddha. We then hopped on city bus #23 to Tai O fishing village before taking bus #11 all the way back to Tung Chung. All in all, a very good day of sightseeing.
Trip by Ferry. So many bikes everywhere.The resort on the island was really lay back and peacefull, surrounded by lovely beach area and local market, full of locals going about their daily chores.

What a cable car!. WE had to queue for one and a half hours, so pre-book if you can, its well worth it. It takes 25 mins to reach the top with the airport to the right. we went through thick clouds absolutely amazing.

Panaromic View. It is an experience in itself. Glass bottom cable cars are available if one is willing to pay extra. There is a long queue at the cable car station. The view from the cable car is panoramic and enjoyable.

Nice island but touristy. Lantau Island is nice but really for tourists. There's the big Buddha which is nice. Is better to look at it from the ground rather than go up to the Big Buddha. Also, there's a monastery that's worth looking at.

Nice Place to Visit. Toured in August when it was hot and humid. Very beautiful natural setting, and the Big Buddha was impressive. The tram ride was really nice giving some great views of the new airport and surrounding areas. At the top of the tram is a shopping village, and I found a cute chopstick store there with a very extensive selection of chopstick sets. The price is reasonable and I could not find anything comparable in the city.

A very spiritual experience. The Big Budda and the temples are both very spiritual experiences and we were taken aback by the beauty of the temple. The cable car offers magnificent views but the queue was very long (nearly one hour).

sightseeing in Lantau Island. One could get there by metro which is cheap and walk, but i went in an organised tour which was most convenient and was able to see all tthe sites that were relevant including the Budha temple and the houses on stilts. Shopping is expensive in the lantau island

Good place to get away from busy Hong Kong island. Lantau Island is a island of many things. The international airport is here as well as the Big Buddha. The cable car link is great and you can trek all over the island. Disneyland park is just a short ride on the MTR or cab from the airport as well as the big outlet mall at Tung Chung. Many hotels and restaurants are dotted all over so you have a choice of where to stay. Ferry service to the mainland are also cheep.
Great place to trekk. I trekked from the nearest Metro line all the way to Buddha and was an amazing trek. Took the cable car on my way down

The cable car is exciting. Took the cable car with the glass bottom. Its exciting and gives an adrenalin rush, fun and safe. Suggest you take the one on your way back as it gets rwally crowded in the evening and the que for tge standard car is atleast 45 min long. Must do though..
Good trip, not so far!. Beautiful nature and nice fresh air. If it's to windy, you can take the bus to the island. It's very relaxing place.

A must see. We arrived early so we did have to queue for a long time to get the tickets. We took the normal cabin as there was too much queue for the Crystal cabin and this is overpriced.There , we enjoyed the place : the big Buddha and the temple. I think that this is a must see while being in Hong Kong but the weather must be nice to enjoy the view and the place.
Multiple attractions. Contains Big Buddha, Disneyland and airport so quite a lot going on, lots of pretty scenery, less commercialised than HK city

Very crowded but worth it! . Please please book your tickets online - it will save you hours in the queue. Using websites like Klook will save you some money as well. We took the standard cabin and the views are quite spectacular. The ride + big Buddha are the biggest attractions. The village is just an artificial construct and not that great. You can walk your way to the big Buddha from the station and it is a good 3-4 hour hop through the jungles but it is well paced and signposted.

great fun trip even in the rain. we bought tickets from 7-11 but got the 360 pass instead of crystal cabin - never mind - take abrolley for rainy day. we ate at the VIP section of the monstarey veg restaurant - was delicious
Great day out. Visit the Buddha via the cable car great views of the International Airport on the way up .Avoid rainy and foggy days

Lantau Island/ Tian Tan Budda. Last visited in 2010, remarkable, breathtaking views. Easy access by subway and then to the cable car. Make sure to bring your walking shoes for the towering set of stairs to see Tian Tan Budda and the temple beneath it. Lovely gift shops and a few places to eat in the village. This is a must see if you come to Hong Kong!

Great Day Trip on Lantau Island. We took the Cable Car ride and saw Tian Tan Buddha and Tai O fishing village. We did a self-guided tour with NGong Ping 360. Everything was very well explained and well run. We also took a boat ride out of Tai O village and saw several pink dolphins! It was incredible! There are tours available as well. I highly recommend this activity.

Out of the hustle & bustle. A great trip (weather permitting to be honest) to see the more green and local side of Hong Kong. Visit the big Buddha and take the Cable cars with a spectacular view over the airport... Something special and if you like take a cable car for a bit more money with a transparent glass bottom, enhances your views..... The story goes that since the Big Buddha was finished no major damage was done to the city by typhoons... Enjoy it and on your way back go to the Outlet center at Tung Chung, always a good bargain there and the real stuff, no fakes..

Mr RP. Is where the Big Buddha and the cable car can be found, the easiest and quickest way to get there is take the metro to the last stop on the orange line, once outside a very short walk across the square is the entrance for the cable car ride.The crystal cable car is an upgrade to the normal cable car the crystal has a glass floor, the ride lasts approx, 30 mins and is absolutely breathtaking and well worth the extra and a much better way to get there than the bus.The queue was not long but well worth the wait. Even in the heat, take your camera you must take photo's.At the end of the cable car ride there are plenty of food and drink venues, and shops a short walk takes you to the Big Buddha and the temple. There are 282 steps approx to get to the top.Take water with you when going up the steps, it's on sale at the bottom and the top, we stopped twice for a wee rest going up the steps, once there it was a photo opportunity, and it was easier coming back down,At the temple it's also a photo opportunity with gift shops etc So this trip was one of the best we had on our stay and well worth the money, esp, the cable car.

A beautiful day trip location. Easy to approach by traveling to the end station of Tung Chung MTR line. There's an outlet mall just by the station, featuring some mid-priced brands and potentially good bargains.Upon exiting the station, we were quickly approached by people selling tickets to the cable car. It is not adviced to buy! We were attempted to be mislead by claiming that travel documentation is required for visiting Lantau, which is not true! In addition, tickets were more expensive there than in the actual cable car location. Cable cars are a short, well instructed walk away from the Tung Chung MTR station. Line was quite long, although progressed resonably quickly. Crystal cabin (glass floor) had a shorter waiting time than the standard one and we were glad to have chosen this one.Expect high price levels in the Ngong Ping village, which is a true tourist location. Tian Tan Buddha and Po Lin monastery are a short walk away from the village.Cable car ride is enjoyable, with beautiful scenery, so it's recommended for at least one direction. Bus was an excellent choice for returning. Bus 23 takes back from Ngong Ping to Tung Chung MTR station for only HKD 17 (Octopus card is accepted), and offers a different, yet interesting view of the beautiful scenery. The ride takes approximately 40 min.

Easygoing day trip on metro, cable car, and easy walking. I take the subway to the end of the line at Tung Chung from Kowloon. From the metro station walk across the plaza in front of the outlet mall and follow the signs around to the cable car station . If you want to pay a bit extra there is a cable car with a glass bottom so you can view the trees and trails below. Even without the glass bottom, the views are stunning as you ascend to the top of Lantau Island. Once at the top there is the village of Ngong Ping with shops and restaurants. There is the huge statue of the Great Buddha with long steps up to the base of the stature which is immense. On one trip I was in charge of five youngsters between the ages of 12-14. I suggested they climb the steps to the top and get pictures taken from the top. They threw themselves into it as I sat like a slug and had an adult beverage and watched from below. Then they hiked back down and we went to lunch. On the way back they were all zonked out asleep from exhaustion. Great fun and great photos. If you don't want to wait for the next cable car there is the number 23 bus that will take you back to Tung Chung. The ride is very scenic and takes you through heavily wooded areas and past some pristine beaches and small villages. At Tung Chung you can pick up the subway MTR and get back to Kowloon. Your Octopus card will get you on the Metro, the cable car and the number 23 bus. Enjoy!

A Best Place. This Place is such nice place in hongkong. Disneyland always a attraction but for me. Ngong Ping Village is also must visit. To reach Ngong Ping Village Cable Car is a first choice. In this specially Glass Bottom. Its give you amazing view of forest. Cable Car journey give you amazing view of hongkong airport. At the top such nice nature view & BIG Buddha is a best place. Even on top you will get a Indian food. also you will visit monastery at the top. At the top you will get free wifi also. On the top you will get 7/11 shops for light food. all most more than 300 small step you will be close to Giant Buddha.
Nice place for kiteboarding fun day. Shui Hau wan where is good for kiteboarding fun day, lesson in Lantau island. There is a Hong kong kiteboaring school to arrange all activity for kiteboard

Go shopping at the Outlet Mall or visit the Big Buddah. From the International Airport take the bus to the central bus station on Lantau Island. Around the corner one way is the Outlet Mall with Food Court and the other way is the cable car ride to visit the Big Buddah. The Buddah is a must using the cable car. Enjoy the views.

Anothe must see!. I suffer from vertigo so was reluctant to go on the cable car, but I'm glad I was "persuaded" by the rest of the family. If the weather is clear, which it was for us, the views are genuinely spectacular. Take the MTR out to the end of the relevant line and the station is a few metres away. We then took a bus (20~30 minutes) to the fishing village on stilts, which was very well worth visiting. All in all, a really good day out.

Countryside and beaches. Fantastic sandy beaches and countryside and mountains for hiking. The best beach for swimming and beach side restaurants is Cheung Sha along the South Lantau road or Pui O beach if you want to see buffalo who graze in the water meadows alongside the village. Go further north to Tai O and take a boat ride to the stilt village and see the pink dolphins out at sea ($25) and then go through the village by foot amongst dried fish hanging up for sale. Go across the bridge amongst the stilt houses along the creek and winds along to the sea. There is a beautiful coastal walk that is best taken from Tung Chung Town all the way to Tai O and takes about 4.5 hrs including a stop for lunch at a local shop with seating outside by the coast. All of these places are reached by a ferry ride from Central to Mui Wo, Lantau and then a bus. Or just enjoy Mui Wo itself which has a beach, restaurants and walks behind the beach into lush countryside and hamlets.

If you're only going to do one tour in HK - pick this one. Everything that was said in the brochure what to expect in this tour was all covered and nothing was missed out. I truly enjoyed myself especially the vegetarian lunch at the monastery. Thumbs up.Thank you to our guide Peter from Grayline Tour!
A must do !. So much fun wiTh the family . Lovely views on the cable cars. Good walk up to the big Buddha.Would definitely do it again..

Lantau Island, Po Lin Monastery, Big Buddha, and Tai O village a great visit. This is a guided tour out of Hong Kong and Kowloon. This was about an 8 hour tour. Pick up at hotel around 8:00 and returned about 4:00 pm. Take the tour bus up to the Ngong Ping 360 skytram to get to the island. This is near the Hong Kong airport. We toured the grounds around the Buddha, visited the monastery, and had the vegetarian lunch at the monastery. After lunch, a few minutes to take some photos and then a bus ride up to the Big Buddha. It is an awesome sight. Once the Big Buddha tour is over, we headed down to Tai O. It is a village on the coast with many of houses on stilts over the water. We had a boat ride out about 1 mile into the South China Sea to see the white dolphins (only location in the world). The dolphins move pretty quick and it may be difficult to get a picture of them. After a small walking tour of Tai O it was back to Hong Kong. If the weather is nice, there are great views from the Buddha and the Skytram. There is plenty of walking and photo ops. There are places to eat other than the monastery. This was a great day away from the crowds of Hong Kong. Would definitely recommend this tour to everyone. Very family friendly. Lawrence was our tour guide and he is highly recommended if you are going on this tour.

Nice to do if you've got a few days in Hong Kong.. Great to visit big buddha! Great fun on the sky rail. It makes a nice change from Hong Kong and makes a good day out before returning to central Hong Kong for the evening.
One island satisfies many wishes. You can find: Disneyland, the Big Buddha, HK Int Airport and can acess to Discovery Bay on Lantau Island. Can get there by means of MTR, ferry, taxis and buses.

Quiet beach close to the Hong Kong hub!. We enjoyed a wonderful swim and beach time on the island, especially after the busy streets and shops of Hong Kong. Hard to believe that this beauty is so close by. Well worth a trip. We did have to wait about half an hour for a bus after we got off the ferry - not many buses on a Sunday and few taxis around too. But nevertheless, worth the wait. Many spots to choose from to enjoy lunch as well, or a drink.

"Blessings of Buddha". While in Hong Kong please do not forget to visit this place. Enjoyable cable car, scenic view, beautiful monastery, Magnificent Buddha statue symbolises peace and harmony. Please try veg food prepared by monks in the monastery.
Clean Island. There is an entrance fee to this island. We arrived here via cable car and it was just gorgeous! We really enjoy the place. There are a lot of entertainment of this place.

Interesting and enjoyable. I visited Lantau Island on my own, having a free day from business. I was staying on Hong Kong Island.It is well worth a visit.You can get there via ferry or the MTR (underground train line) and then the cable car.I chose the MTR and cable car route. This is quite easy. From Central (MTR station red line) you take the train to Tung Chung (MTR orange line), it takes approx half an hour. You exit the MTR and walk across to the 360 Ping cable car ( 2nins walk signposted). The cable car takes approx half an hour to Lantau - it's approx 5.7km over the South China Sea and is very scenic or you could be in the clouds !Lantau is lovely. There are some shops for souvenirs or just browsing and places to eat. That is just the start and certainly not the reason you should go. Walk through the shopping area takes you to the monastery, which is worth a visit and of course to view the Buddah given to Hong Kong from China. You can also get bus's from Lantau to the other parts of the island that are worth visiting - seaside towns, fishing villages etc.There are tour agents that can organise these for you or you can do this independently.Lantau has a lot of history and is very interesting. A good day out for everyone including children.

A Mecca One should Spend At Least One day. Don't miss the Lantau Trail, as most tourist head to the Buddha and forget another jewel of this island. Lo Kei Wan, for example, epitomises the pleasant camp site of the Lantau Trail Section 9. According to old fishermen, Lo Kei Wan was once a haunt of pirates. Now, you will find this place a great reward near the end of your Trail Section 9 hike.
cool cable car ever. I took the crystal car and it's awesome. you can see the sea mountain and waterfall. should get there on sunny day it must be good to get nice photo.

Beautiful, scenic, peaceful getaway. I'd really recommend spending a day in Lantau Island if you have the time. I'd suggest going on a week day in the morning, as weekends can be a bit crowded, especially if you want to take the cable car. I went Sunday morning around 11am and the line for the cable car took me about 1 hr 45 mins in total :( Overall, I'd say the cable car was nothing special, but fairly cheap so still a worthwhile experience if you have extra HK dollars to spare.The island itself is very cute - the Big Buddha is definitely worth seeing, if not just to catch a nice cool breeze and admire the view. The thousand buddhas in the back temple also really breathtaking. The Wisdom Trail is nice, as is the Lantau Peak trail (though quite the hike - bring 2-3 bottles of water for the 2.5 hour endeavor).I went on a cloudy day, which was great, because it wasn't too hot or humid. Left with no sunburns, and only was able to apply sunscreen once!But DON'T fall asleep on the bus back from Tai O village! I made the mistake of doing so, and woke up back on the main island :( Totally missed the Ngong Ping village stop, and wasn't able to take the cable car on the way back after buying a round trip ticket!

Highlight of our trip. We took the cable car to the monastery and had a wonderful day. It is 7 km long and the views are amazing. Even when lines are long, they move you along quickly. It was less crowded than HK and a unique and enjoyable experience. We will recommend it to any friends travelling to Hong Kong.

Amazing place in the midst of nature !!!!. A great experience right from the word go...5.7 km Ngong Ping Ropeway ..nice village setting ..The Big Buddha and Po Lin Monastery was a unique experience...Stage and motion 360 is of kids liking.....Nice friendly staff...Good housekeeping overall..Must Visit when in Hong Kong.

Quite and serene. Quite and serene place to spend a afternoon. The cable car ride is expensive but worth the view of the city. Suggest you take glass bottom cable car and book online as there are long queue to purchase tickets. Also there are separate queue for standard and glass cabins.

An Excellent Day. We took a day tour with Buffalo Tours and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The toilet equipped ferry from HK to Lantau Island was clean and fast and its large windows afforded excellent views. Our guide was informative, helping us to understand where we were and what we were visiting. Our first stop, Cheung Sha Wan beach, had a swimming enclosure, lifeguards and changing room/ toilets. The beach was sandy but there was a fair amount of litter. Tai O fishing village was excellent. We wandered through its market place before taking a short boat ride which provided good views of the houses, complete with sewage pipes which empty straight into the creek. Don't even think of trailing your hand in the water. At Po Lin we climbed up steep steps onto the huge Tian Tan Buddah before enjoying a yummy vegetarian lunch at the nearby monastery. A short walk through the shops of Ngon Ping village took us to a cable car terminal which gave us the most exhilarating 25 minute ride back to ground level. The views from here of the new airport are stupendous. This is a great way to spend a day in Hong Kong.

Great day out. The cable car ride over has breathtaking views of Hong Kong, absolutely stunning. That only sets you up for what is going to be a great day. The moment you see the Giant Buddha is a real wow moment and you can't wait to get there. Once you arrive you can wander through all of the shops and food outlets, but you're best to wait until you're leaving to get souvenirs rather than carry them around with you.This is also the meeting point for an additional tour that you can go on, you have to buy your tickets at the same time as buying the cable car tickets. I highly recommend going on this tour, it takes you by air conditioned bus with guide to a fishing village where you then go out onto the water on a tourist water taxi. You can have a wander around the fishing village after the boat ride and buy some local items.Once you get back, the guide takes you through a temple and it's there that he leaves you.The stairs up to the Buddha are a killer if you're not very fit, but well worth the climb and it's a lot easier going down. You can wander around the base of the Buddha to get 360 degree views.Going on the tour also gives you a fast pass for the cable car on the way home, so you can skip the queues which can be worth it. Lantau Island is a very popular tourist destination so it can get quite busy late morning and afternoon.The souvenir shops have all kinds of gifts for people of all ages, so bring lots of money.

Off the beaten track. You can get close to nature on this island or go off the beaten track to Mui Wo and adjoining areas - the bus ride through the hills itself is worth the journey ... and off course the island has Disneyland
nice view at the skyline of HK. its not overpriced and offer nice adventure while enjoying HK skyline. you can see everything from here, HK airport, city, mountains. Its quite hot during summer.
Plenty to do and see. Not exactly away from the noise and bustle as it is a very busy place - the cable car ride is outstanding, the 360 experience exhilarating, and the 'Big Buddha's is a must see.

nice for day trip amazing cable car experience. This is definetly a must watch for hongkong tour. We went in morning on sunny day so take umbrella and sunscream. The cable car was great, no need to spend extra for 360 degree one.The view from cable car is amazing with entire view of hongkong airport. The park at the top and Buddha statue is worth watching. They are few shows at the top but we didnt see them so no idea. Souviner shops are good.

Greenery every where . Little far from central Hong Kong (approx 30 min), this place is surrounded by sea and hills. Citygate mall offers almost everything on discounted price through out the year. Ngong ping cable car is one of the major attraction which takes you to big Buddha. Airport is just 15 min away from this place. Full of natural air and far away from pollution and crowd.
Ticket price worth the cable car ride alone. Must see in Hong Kong, even more than the Peak in my opinion. The Cable car ride was great - don't pay extra for the crystal cabin though.
Excellent although cable car fares a bit expensive. We decided to take the cable car going there. Expensive but totally worth the expenses. The view from the cable car were fabulous.
great. This was great to visit and very peaceful but exciting. Love going there and see what new things they have added. Very nice
Good view. It's so crowded on weekend. Suggest to go there in the morning. It's takes 30 min. in the cable car.
Nice to Get out the City. Lantau is a Nice Get Away from the City and good to get there from Central by Ferry. Lots to see and do for the Day and Beaches are Nice.

Beautiful Island !. Good place to walk. There is Ngong Ping and in this village, you can see Grand Bouddha and visit it. You can, with the bus, see the other isles and that's really cool to see local people how they cook, work, etc. It's largely different from Central or Kowloon lol.
Must have !

A tourist trap but cable car has great views. The large outdoor Buddha at Lantau was completed around 1995 and so is nowhere in the league of the other shrines and monasteries in south east Asia. That being said it is fun to walk around and admire the effort it took to erect a structure of such height. The area around this site is filled with tourist shops at exorbitant prices. The Po-Lin monastery is worth taking a quick look particularly the room with the gold Buddhas.When we last visited the island 15 or so years ago the lunch at the monastery was prepared and served by monks and was free. This is no longer the case, one is forced to choose a fixed menu at an exorbitant price and the quality and taste of the food disappointing. We would suggest avoiding eating at the monastery altogether. For us the main highlight of the trip was the cable car to and from the island as the views were great.

Huge, underpopulated island to explore. We got a summer rental for a few weeks in Mui Wo (Silvermine bay) and explored the waterfall, temples, and hiking trails while biking most places and going to the beach almost every day. There is much to explore all around the island.

Beautiful View and Great to Spend a Few Hours. Lantau Island was my absolute favorite place to visit in Hong Kong, I actually wish I had an opportunity to explore more. The cable car ride was beautiful with a breathtaking view of HK. Walking up the steps to the Big Buddha was awesome and the hard work is rewarded with a spectacular panoramic view. I would have loved to go for a hike along one the many trails here, but due to heat and humidity, this just wasn't doable. Also, they have some other excursion options on the sea shore, but didn't try this out either. Good way to spend part of the day. It is crowded here, but there is enough open space to feel like you're on your own.

Highlight of our trip. We travelled from Tshim Sha Tsui by the MTR on the red line, changed onto the orange line at Central and onto Lantau Island where you walk easily out to the clearly marked cable car stop. We arrived about 10:30-11am, and the line-up for the cable car was already very, very long. However it does move very quickly because there are about 10 counters selling tickets. We waited in queue for only 5 minutes before reaching the counter and buying our tickets.TIP: Spend the extra $8AUD pp and get seats on the glass-bottom car ("crystal cabin") - the wait for these cars is MUCH shorter because they're slightly more expensive!! It is worth the extra money just to skip the queue to board!! Plus the glass bottom is generally a cool experience.We paid for a one-way cable car ticket and got off at the top in Nong Ping Village. This is a FAKE village, built specifically for tourists. It is very pretty, but don't spend all your money in the expensive government-owned shops. Some of the shops on the right seem to be owned by locals and have better prices if you see something you fancy. (For example, I bought a little hand-made bowl very cheap and there were also other bits and pieces like nice bracelets for only $20HKD (like $2.5AUD).)From Nong Ping Village you follow the tourists to the Giant Buddha and also the Buddhist Monastery. Don't pay for a silly tour! You can do this all yourself by following the other tourists and its all free! After the Giant Buddha and Monastery we returned to Nong Ping Village to catch the bus to the Tai O fishing village on the other side of Lantau Island. If you don't know which bus, etc, ask a few people, you will usually find a young person who speaks English. The locals are VERY helpful if they can be! The bus is about $17HKD pp.Tai O Village is fantastic. Again, follow the flow of tourists around the village to look at the shops and wander around. You will soon find the stilt houses and other sights mentioned in various tours. It is all free! The locals allow tourists to walk freely around their homes and streets because tourists help to support this fairly poor society. But try to be respectful! Say hello to the locals as you walk past. Be polite. Don't forget you are walking around their homes. Don't be rude tourists! In the heart of the stilt houses in Tai O is a recently opened cafe where you can sit outside on the river and look out over the boats and lovely view while taking a coffee/beer/tea, etc. There is also food available. The people who run the cafe do so out of their home and they are SO nice, friendly and lovely. Even in the most opressively humid weather, sitting on the river provides a lovely cooling breeze. This cafe is truely a gem! I think if I lived in Hong Kong I would travel to Lantau Island JUST to sit here and have a coffee. Don't miss it if you visit Tai O Village. From Tai O, we walked back to the bus stop and caught a 40 min bus to another village where the ferry back to Hong Kong (Kawloon side) is located. It is easy to locate and pretty clearly marked. Just check out some tourist maps and it will all make sense! The bus ride is really cool. It runs through thick "jungle" where you expect monkeys and lions to pop out at every turn. It is very pretty.The ferry, again, is easy to traverse and very cheap. It takes you back to the harbour where you can then find the MTR to wherever you need. Lantau Island was the best day we spent in Hong Kong. It was scenic and interesting. However, not for the faint hearted when it is very hot! The hike up to see the Giant Buddha is challenging and there is quite a bit of walking between the Monastery and Nong Ping and around Tai O. However, it was such a great adventure and the cable car is not to be missed!

Peace and Quiet and Relaxation. We came to Lantau Island to get away from the hustle and bustle of the part of downtown we were staying in. It was an easy metro ride over, followed by a beautiful cable car ride to the island. The ride was quite peaceful, and the some of the views were fantastic. Once on the island, Big Buddha provided some immediate satisfaction. It was definitely a cool site to see. We also ended up getting lunch on site. It wasn't anything special. A fun place to relax for a few hours!
Layover side trip. Enjoyed spending 10hrs layover going around here and visit the big buddha though its tiring to reach the top...

Nice gondola ride. Please take the once with glass floor so you get enjoy the views much better as you would be sent up over the ridges of the Lantau Peak. The almost 30 min ride is fantastic in summer as the views of green amidst mist is simply stunning and peaceful ...
Amazing!. The breathtaking view from cable car is awesome! Nothing much to see the island apart from a giant Buddha statue and gift shops.

Lantau-nature and culture. You easily go to Lantau by Metro and when going in the lift you get a beautiful view of the landscape. Om Lantau there is a cultural park which is somewhat touristic but also beautiful and peaceful.
Buddha. You have not experienced the culture in HK until you've climbed what seems like hundreds of stairs to the "big Buddha"
Worthwhile. Spent half day on this tour, it is a lil bit far from the central, took the mtr all the way the Tung Chung, but the view worth the time spent on the train, fresh air and amazing scenery.
nice cable car experience. one of the longest cable car ride. try out the crystal cabin. nice view and experience. ngong ping village - average visiting.

Must see. Lantau is very near the airport so I suggest going here first before heading to the city center, or go here last and explore while you wait for your flight. Don't worry about luggage as there are lockers inside Citygate mall (small locker costs 10HKD every 2hrs) which is very near from where you ride the cable cars. You'll spend a minimum of 2 hours here. There are stalls where you can buy food and drinks that aren't that expensive. The view is great, the cool air refreshing. Went on a weekday and it wasn't crowded.

Should take the rope way to Lantau. Lantau Island has the disney land and the big buddha statue. It's very near to the HongKong airport. The island also has lots of options of shop for souvenirs but would be a bit more expensive than ladies market. Should take the rope way in Lantau island.. it's the most awesome of them of all. It's really long and the view of the airport and surrounding places from the rope way is brilliant.

Very good trip to understand/see what Hong Kong really is.. The trip we booked included the Cable car up to the Big Buddha and Ngong Ping village,then we took a coach down the mountain to a real fishing village called Tai O, which still has houses built over the water on stilts. I have to say, those houses are impressive, many of them even have balconies hahahahahahahaha. We then had a boat trip out into the bay, where there was a slim chance of seeing the rare Chinese White Dolphins,which we did not manage to see but we did get a better view of the scale of the new bridge they are building, with the mainland for the new rapid train rail-line and motorway to Beijing,which will be the biggest suspension bridge in the world at over 50km long. By the way, if you have 10,000HD to spare, you can buy the speciality fish dish which is the fish's stomach dried out. If you have any energy left after this trip...........well done hahahahahahahaha

Explore Lantau Island. Lantau Island is the backyard of Hong Kong. Other than visiting the Big Buddha and cable car, I would like to suggest to try out an easy hiking trail from Tung Chung to Tai O. The route level is not that difficult. It is along the sea shore of the island. If start walking aprroimately11 am with relaxing steps, you should arrive Tai O around 3pm. Then do a couple hours walk and discover this little fishing village, also can enjoy the famous sea food before heading home.
Green lungs of Hong Kong. Lantau Island is a must see. Many green hills covered with trees, great area to take a break from city rush and go for hiking. Recommended.

Hanging in the sky. After a visit to the great Buddha we rode the Landau tram down to the MTR. While I live near a revolving tram in Palm Springs, this one, billed as the world's longest, gives and exciting view of The entire Hong Kong area including the airport. Definitely worth a ride.

Hong Kong best countryside with nice hiking trails and good scenery. A lot of hiking trails to the 2nd highest peak in HK. You will see beautiful sunset and stars night if you are lucky enough. Not to mention the village for fishery Tai O and the big Buddha. Must see!!!
SO BEAUTIFUL AND CLEAN. we went by ferry to discovery island. It was beautiful. A nice beach , some lovely temples and good eating places.

Great place to camp and very special!. Great for hiking, camp and explore the nature of hong kong!if you have an extra time in Hong kong, you can explore the natural beauty of it, having unique sedimentary and metamorphic rocks.Also the beach is the cleanest and the most beautiful in Hong Kong!!!The only thing I dont like it is the transport of it. You can only take the boat. or maybe take MTR travel to Tung Chung and interchange station from there and take the boat.
See the big Buddha and do the Cable car ride. We did this island as a tour it included the Big Buddha, cable car ride and the fishing village. All enjoyable and a different view of Hong Kong

Beautiful country side with modern facilties. This location is great for both country side experience and modern world. If you like mountain hiking there are ample if mountain for hiking. If you like shopping and food, you have Tung Chung mall, if you like nice drink by the beach, you have discovery bay. If you like a little old fishing village you can go to Tai-O. And as if it is not enough, you can go to catch a cable car ride up the mountain to the Great Buddha from Tung Chung cable car station where you can also have a great view of the Hong Kong International airport and with some luck, you can catch the Airbus A380 taking off.

A nice respite from the hustle and bustle of HK Central. Lantau is a welcome respite from all the hustle and bustle of Central and Kowloon, but still with all the glamour that HK has to offer! Citygate Outlets, Disneyland, Ngong Ping 360, etc..the island is not only known as the HK Airport island; it has much more to offer with less crowds to boot.

amazing view!. me and my kids use the crystal cable car and the view was breathtaking! the cable traveled for a long way so its worth it!my only suggestion you have to buy your tickets online..because they have another line for already prebook tickets which is more shorter than when you buy their..we bought our tickets in klook.com and its more cheap,just be sure to print your prebook tickets so less worry..the standard cable car line is more long than the crystal cable car..but they are more frequent..i advise those who have kids to buy the crystal cable as it offers more breathtaking view,but this ofcourse if your kids are not afraid..
PHEW!. This is a long way form "Dowbtown" Hong Kong, but if you're patient and careful the subway system is excellent and will get you there.Well worth the effort.
Lantau beaches . - the beaches at Lantau is clean, calm and very safe to swim.- better to go by fast ferry as it is very fast an air conditioned .

A visit to the island is a must!. Taking the Ngong Ping cable care at least once in your lifetime is a must. I'm not sure if standing in a queue for up to 3 hours in scourging heat is worth a second trip.

Lantau Island Monastery Day Excursion. A very interesting tour which took us to the Lantau Island for a day's visit to see Tai O, Giant Buddha statue, Po Lin Monastery and Ngon Ping. Vegetarian lunch was delicious even for those of us who usually like to have meat in our meals. The return journey on the cable car ride was very nice with great views.
Must visit Destination. Lantau Island gives a unique experience of travelling by cable car which goes over the sea route. It gives a very nice view of the overall Hong Kong coastal line

Lantau Island Day Trip. Great day, well organized by tour group. Covered all points of interest; Upper Cheung Sha Beach, Tai O fish market & fishing village including short boat ride through houses on stilts, Big Buddha, Monastery with nice vegetarian lunch, Ngong Ping village & cable car ride. Arrived by ferry which was also gave good views of the island. Would definitely recommend.

Great day round trip. Staying in the Kowloon area we caught the MTR red line changing at Lai King to the orange line to TungChung ( about 30 mins). Exit B and either head straight over to the bus terminus for the cheaper way up to the top or head slightly to the left for the cable car - we opted for the one way standard at 130 per adult. There was no queue for the tickets at 9.30 am on a Saturday morning and only a short queue moving at the pace of the cable cars arriving. The pre booked tickets and crystal cabins both had much longer lines and waiting times. We enjoy the climb to the Budda, visit to monastery and wisdom path walk. Instead of returning the same way we planned to use the bus 21 to Tai O fishing village (leave 20 mins past each hour officially but when a crowd of people were there they just put on an extra bus. Boat trip out was a bit and village was a bit disappointing fof us who have seen better stilt villages elsewhere. The Bus 1 goes about every 30 mins - about 50 minute tour across the island ( there are a number of beaches you could stop at on the way or spend some time in to Mui Wo where you can catch the ferry back to Central, HongKong island ( about an hour) with interesting views of many of the other outlying islands.

WORTH A DAY VISIT. People keep visiting just because of the cable car , but i would beg to differ . Apart from being away from the Hong kong traffic , pollution and honking , this is a place of meditating between the wilderness. The Trails all around the Island is exceptional . My wife and i walked around the island and spent quite some times admiring nature .

Good half day activity. Lantau Island is about 1hr away from central Hong Kong. You can visit the island by1. Taking a train from HK station and then via ngong ping cable car2. Driving to the islandThe first option is what we used and what I would recommend. The cable car takes about 25 min to drop you to the island. And you can easily spend 3 hrs at the island visiting many important points

Great day out. Fabulous day out, different, diverse, and I really appreciated not feeling overwhelmed by the crowd despite knowing there were so many tourists at once! The space is so big, you can really find peace and tranquility!

Natural beauty of Hong Kong. Nature lover's you just cannot miss Lantau Island when you are in Hong Kong. You can get some spectacular click on your camera here. You can use the cable car, bus or even trek to the big Buddha.

Semi rural escape from the urban jungle . Very nice part of Hong Kong, full of outdoor attractions and nature walks. Trip to Ngong Ping by cable car, visiting fishing village and taking boat ride, taking nature walks on well marked trails are the most popular activities among few more. One day is not enough to enjoy all though. Very well connected to international airport. It's a must see among every single itinerary to Hong Kong for sure.

A Big Fogy World to explore Budha. We visited the island on last April. For us it was full day foggy / misty experience. The cable car drive is exciting for a first timer but will get bored later unlike Genting Island in Malaysia.The Island was full of cold mist and it was a nice journey to walk upto Budha and come back. Because of the mist no one could see the Budha statue, but could feel the budha in a greater way.It was worth to visit. The unpleasant part of the journey is the waiting for more than 1 hour to catch the cable car.

the big Buddah. If going to Lantau Island to see the big Buddau, from our experience, I would say, leave it until the middle of the day, as we spent over an hour queued up to get onto the cable car, but when we were returning in the early afternoon there was almost no queue. Worth the wait though. Such a peaceful place with plenty of space for the crowds to spread out in, so it didnt feel crowded when we got there.

Lived here.. its nice. We lived in Discovery Bay on Lantau during our expat assignment.. if you have enough time during your stay in HK.. go see the buddha on Lantau and also consider a trailhike in the beautiful hills on Lantau.. especially to Mui Wo for example (you can reach the island by MTR or directly from central by ferry)..

A Great Cable Car Ride and a Huge Buddha Statue. A tour of Lantau Island includes spectacular views from the cable car which travels for a few kilometres across the island to where one can walk to the Giant Buddha. From the Cable Car you have a birds eye view of the International Airport and the surrounding islands of Hong Kong.
A view to behold. Stunning views of Lantau Island and the Hong Kong International Airport with aeroplanes taking off from runways.
Worth the visit. Cable car ride, although foggy, was still an experience and you could still view things.Lots of steps up to view the buddha but worth it and again fantastic view and so tranquil.

Nothing Like Hong Kong. Lantau Island is Discovery Bay on one side and Sunny Bay on the other. Disco Bay is a beach and two small shopping plazas with small restaurants, joined by buses (no cars allowed) and accessed by ferry. Sunny Bay has HK Disneyland and is accessed by train. There are some steep walking tracks.It's all new development and nothing like HK island.

360 cable car. Great trip good view over islands. Allow 4-5 hours so you have time to go up to the Buddha. It would pay to purchase tickets prior to trip otherwise you can queue for up to an hour. Lots of culture. Must see on trip to Hong kong

Cable Car plus Shopping!. This location is very near the Airport. If you want to save time, you may opt to go here after arrival or before departure if you have enough time.Cable car ride is their attraction, but we go here for the Shopping! There are lots of Outlet Stores in CityGate Mall that are really cheap imports! But dont forget to check out Mongkok if your looking for cheap buys.

A contrast to Hong Kong Island. A boat trip here gives a sense of scale and perspective to Hong Kong island - Lantau is probably a bit bigger but not too different in scale, a relatively undeveloped (apart from the vast towers of Tung Chung, and the airport) version of the same landscape, containing an artificial reservoir, a prison, and the Big Buddha (an essential visit here and to the monastery). Travel around by bus to get the feel of the place.
Many attractions . Lantau Island has many attractions: Disneyland, Pgong Ping, Big Budha, etc. We loved all these attractions, and we are looking forward to go back soon!

Buy tickets online to beat what can be crushing lines (queues). Lantau is a great destination, don't miss Po Lin monastery and it's VIP lunch. A lot of folk get diverted by the Big Bhudda but the monastery is a treat by itself.
great place +. We was visiting Landtau island it beautiful and fun ,we are so happy the first time to coming here ...
Great Ride.. We enjoyed the ride to the top and we did the return trip. Still fun evening on a wet day. If you only have a day or in Hong Kong this is a must to do.

Unforgettable trip with great views. No way to miss such a great attraction at Lantau Island. It is worthy to spend half a day just for the trip on the cable car itself and the rewarding experience of getting to the top and witness a fantastic view. Is good for kids as well, even during hot summer time.
