Awesome Cable car ride . Lantau is adjecent to Airport. You can reach to the cable car station which is just opposite to Tung Chu line. Tickets cost you 185 $ for return standard cabin and 255$ for crystal cabin. Amazing 25 min cable car ride to reach the village. On reaching the village you see 100 + sovereign shops and Big Buddha statue after climbing 200 stairs. Last cable car ride is 6.30 pm and Big Buddha gets closed by 5.30 pm. Worth spending couple of hours here if you are flying on the evening or late night.
Fun experience.. Great gondola ride over, beautiful views. You can pre-purchase your tickets which I would recommend to save time otherwise the lines can be long.

Spectacular Views! . I would definitely recommend taking a trip to Lantau Island with the cable car. The views are spectacular and so worth it. We took the mtr from tsim sha tsui (red line) to central station, walked over to the Hong Kong line (orange line) and took the train directly to Tung Chung. From there it's a 5min walk to the cable car rides. The last cable car leaves Lantau Island at 18:00. I suggest heading to the exit by 17:00 as the queues do get very long. There are many restaurants you can eat from and there is a temple you can get cheap vegetarian food at. I will however recommend Ebenezer restaurant. It is value for money and the best Turkish food in HK. MRound trip: HK$ 187Duration: 25mins each way. Maximum of 8 people per carAttractions: Giant Budha, temple, spectacular views, and great atmosphere. Tip: be prepared for very long queues min of 50mins wait. Also if you are afraid of heights, it might not be the best mode of transport. There are buses that drive that route. Edk

unreal. This is a must do. We had no interest to see another Budda but were told about the cable car. What a view. The cable cars were roomy and very clean. The view just blows your mind. You get to see the new bridge/road that's been built from mainland Hong Kong to the island of Macau. 66 kms long. Its not finished yet. We were pleasantly surprised when we saw the Budda/Monastery and surrounding country side. So pleased we did the trip.

Good if lines are reasonable. Worth it if line isn't too long, so best avoided on weekends. Cable car ride probably the highlight of the experience, care of the views during the trip. Village itself is very gimmicky but nice to go for a bit of a walk around beyond this area - probably get a bit sick of it after 30-45 minutes. Available food options are very poor, so better to plan around that. The available walks look like they'd be nice but a bit remote as they wind their way away from the central attraction and deep into the bush

Pleasant. Worth coming here to visit the Big Buddha, and perhaps spend some time in the Ngong Ping 360 village. There are other things like Tai O fishing village and the Cheung Sha Beach which you can explore if you have time to kill.
Very Quaint!. By all means take the cable car, the views are fantastic. Totally breathtaking and the small villages are wonderful to explore!

amazing cable car views and charming fishing village. get the crystal cabin with that glass bottom floor! didn't have to wait too long for the tickets even though it was quite a queue. had a whole cabin all to ourselves on the way back. climbed the stairs up the big buddha and went to tai o fishing village by bus. have your fully charged camera with you, plenty of pretty photo opportunities. there's a small boat that takes you out to see dolphins at the village for a small fee but we weren't lucky enough to witness that. cant remember this, do check the timing for the last cable car going back :)

Breathtaking views. Lantau island is definitely worth a visit in Hong Kong. It hosts a village called Ngong Pine to which you take a cable car to reach there overlooking the green mountains and the water underneath. It also hosts the Big Buddha and the widsom path in the mountains.

Worth visiting. We spent a couple nights on the southside, near Silvermine Beach and enjoyed it very much - very quiet,and a nice hiking trail to nearby waterfalls. We took the Miu Woo ferry from HK Central - very convenient.

Loved our trip to Hong Kong and really enjoyed the Culture and Heritage tour to Lantau. This is going to be one of my finest memory visiting Lantau Island at Hong Kong. Beautiful place! Scenic. The giant Buddha slowly comes into view as you journey over Lantau inside the Ngong Ping 360 cable car offering spectacular 360-degree views. This tour combines all of Lantau's beloved sites into around four hours of non-stop exploring. Stroll through the Ngong Ping Village and then trek up to 268 steps the peaceful giant Buddha, a Hong Kong icon. From sky to water, this tour will satisfied our cravings to see all of this beautiful isle. There are two types of tickets available for the Tram Cabins. Round trip standard or crystal cabin cable car tickets o. We used the standard one since the crystal one was overbooked. in the crustal cabin the only difference is that the floor of the cabin is of thick glass and you could see the scenes beneth you. Anyway you can see the same in the Standard class. You can find a good deal at klook.com for these trams. We had to wait in the line for about 60 huge minutes to board the trams. But it was all worth it once we are on the peak. Lovely lovely view. The Buddha statue is mesmerising and you could stare it forever. You must be reach the Ngong Ping village at one of the following times. The bracketed time is the latest you should be retrieving your tickets from Tung Chung Cable Car Terminal for best experience. 11:30 (10:35 ticketing)12:30 (11:35 ticketing)13:30 (12:35 ticketing)15:00 only during weekend & public holiday (14:05 ticketing)There is one interesting thing , is when you go down the 268 steps, there is a circle just exactly in the same line of buddha's statue. If you stand on that circle and speak something you could hear your own echo. Not many knew this and when we tried this (as one of the locals informed us) it was mind blowing. Once must try it.

Terrific travel. The travel of lantau till the Buddha peak one should definitely do and take tickets of crystal cable only. The view what you can experience through crystal cable that you can never experience through the normal cable car. During the trip it takes you above the sea, forest and the view you can see from your cable downwards. The crystal cable is totally transparent and the line of this cable is small as well as it is a bit costly than normal cable car so few people take this one. We reached over here early in the morning so that we can avoid bigger lines to buy the tickets. And by the time we reached back it was to crowed OMG. But the overall experience for us it was fantastic of our travel. We went through the clouds, above the sea, forest which we could see through and fell. Specially when we went through clouds it was all around and we could see anything. But the experience was amazing the clouds came inside as well through the little partition. Uhhh it was amazing.

Cable Cars.. We went on the crystal cabin, well worth the extra money. The view was great, especially the looking down through the glass floor.
We would use the crystal cabin again next time.

Have a charged camera. BOOK A TOUR. Reason is that you skip the biggest queue I've seen in years for the cable car and it is very comprehensive and worth the money. We saw the Big Buddha, Monestry, Fishing Village and the Cable Car. It was 4-5 hours of fun. We had several guides, all excellent.

Discovery Bay. 20 minute ferry trip from Pier 3 in HK. Great beach, waterfront restaurants and plaza with umbrellas and picnic-style benches. Check out Sunday craft markets here too (certain Sundays in the month only).

Best views in Hong Kong. Cable car is amazing.
The Big Buddha is stunning.
The temples are breathtaking.
Highly recommended distraction to the bustle of Hong Kong.
wow. The whole trip was amazing. I would recommend to book ticket online or use klook application to book it. you will get good deals. If possible take Glass Cable car, it adds in adventure and fun.

Largest sitting Buddha in Hong Kong. The cable car leading to the island was closed for maintenance during our visit. Hence, we took a bus ride within the cable car station. The journey takes about 25 minutes.We climb up 268 steps to the siting Buddha at the hill top. You can buy your vegetarian foods within the statue complex. At the food hill there is the monastery located. Besides the monastery there is a cafe selling all types of pastry & desserts. Foods are good.Further down the monastery towards the bus station therein is the Lamma Village where you can buy your souvenirs.After this site we took a bus ride to the fishing village where houses are built on stilts. You may also pay for boat ride to watch for the Dolphins. Each person is HK20-25 dollars. We did not participate as it was a very hot sunny day.

Cable car ride has glorious views. Very touristy however this is expected, went midweek and was still a long queue for the cable car, but completely worth it, this with the Buddha make for a lovely day out sightseeing.

Great thing to do when in Hong Kong. We went to Lantau Island after lunch. Very easy to get to by MTR, then simply catch the cable car. The cable car is long and awesome, fantastic view and lot's of fun. Pay extra to get one with the glass bottom floor. When we arrived at the top we went to see the Bruce Lee show which was half way through. I wish we had arrived at the start, as the half of the show we saw was excellent. So much so, that on our next visit I want to go back to Lantau Island to see the full show.No visit to Lantau is complete without a walk up to the top of Lantau's Big Buddha. Fabulous view from the top. Plenty of photo opportunities, so take your camera.Tip: Weekends and holidays can be very busy and expect long waits for the cable car. We went late afternoon after lunch and there was practically no queuing.

Lantau Island. Try to avoid this place on the weekend. Far too many tourist. Easy to get to via MTR. The cable car trip to the Big Buddha is quite exciting. The village itself has some great food stalls and amusement areas for the family and children. The climb up to the bronze Buddha statue is very exhilerating with a Museum at the bottom of the statue. Be careful going home. The line up to catch the cable car can be very daunting. If it is too long you can catch a Bus down the mountain. That is an experience in itself. A great day out.

very nice. it is a very nice place to visit, you get to see all the local food and even see how they make it sometimes, a lot of nice locally own restaurants, and try to get the boat to see the pink dolphins if you are lucky you might see some, it depends on them, but even if they don want to be seen it is nice just to enjoy the boat trip.
A thrilling cable car ride. A long and steep cable car ride, up to the big Buddha statue. There's lots to do on the island, be prepared for a lot of walking there!

Beautiful place. Lantau Island, the largest of Hong Kong's islands, Its has a mountainous terrain , to be crossed by the 70km Lantau Trail to Lantau Peak. There there is Po Lin Monastery which has the bronze Tian Tan Buddha, a 34m-tall statue on a hilltop reached by a cable car.
airport, big buddha, tai O. We enjoyed our time visiting Lantau. We walked all around Tai O. Visited the Big Buddha. Nice place to visit.
Recommended!. Had a great time visiting the Buddha and using the sky tram. There seemed to be lots to do on the island but we didn't visit much else. Would recommend otherwise.
Must see. Don't fail to visit. I liked it very much. Something different in these days to find .. So calm etc . Souvenirs expensive according to Indian currency.

Well worth a visit - culture and scenery. You access Lantau Island via the cable car which is easy to access from the MTR - past the outlet mall. The queue can be horrible so well worth buying tickets in advance (we used Klook) so you can bypass those buying tickets on the dayThe gondola takes about 20 minutes and offers views of the airport if you find such things interestingOnce in the island head to the Buddha. We paid a small amount to see the relic which included ice cream and cold water at the top of the steps. This allowed us access inside the Buddha which has some interesting things to look at and offered a respite from the oppressive heat and humidity.Back down in the village we explored the wisdom walk (and marvelled at those that had hiked up and around the island ) and went to the 10000 Buddhas monastery. It isn't huge but wow - just wow! So worth it - reminded us of the forbidden city in Beijing minus a few thousand people. Don't miss it!

Great views of Hong Kong and Buddha. We had a fun day as we explored Lantau Island. We took the cable car for the views, the bus to the seaport for dolphin watching and enjoyed a little shopping. If you suffer from motion sickness, you should be warned that the bus ride is fast and through the mountains. We didn't see any dolphins which made the boat ride a little anti-climactic.

the best Island by far!. this THE island! this is where Disney land is, where you can really feel far away from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong. from Sunny Bay station, take a bus to its last stop where you will reach the ferries and lots of great restaurants overlooking the sea and a beach. the last stop on the MTR has a really nice outlet mall.
Beautiful. The airport and several tourist spots are located on Lantau Island. Very enjoyable and picturesque island.
In development. It seems like everything is being built on the island. A new airport, cranes eevrywhere and now a road and a bridge from Lantau to Macau and the mainland. Wow!!

Brilliant Place to Hike and Escape the Heat. If you fancy a beautiful but easy hike. I suggest the Lantau Country Trail from Pak Au to Nam Shan. Take the Mui Wo ferry from Pier 6 in Central and once you get to Mui Wo the 3M bus and get off at Pak Au. The stop is announced it is at the top of a steep hill. Quite a few hikers will get off your bus as quite a few of Lantau hikes start or finish here. Cross the road and climb the few steps to the pavilion. There are two hikes that begin here, the Sunset Peak hike which is a rigorous hike in the heat of summer but very beautiful and the Lantau Country Trail which is a beautiful easy walk perfect for a summers day. The views from this hike are amazing. It crosses many streams and waterfalls so don't forget to bring some snacks as well as water. The hike is about 6 KM and takes me a leisurely 90 minutes and longer if I sit and enjoy the views. The hike ends at Nam Shan so take the signs to the South Lantau Road where you can pick up a bus back to Mui Wo and lunch and a swim or cross the South Lantau Road where you can get the 2 bus to Ngong Ping and Big Budha, 1 bus to Tai O and the Doplphins or 3M to Tung Chung.There is so much to see and do on Lantau that you easily spend a day (or more) here.
Lots of tourist attractions. I really love this island because it is peaceful and lots of great scenery. There are many tourist attraction which is easily accessible.
good place to spend the whole day there!. lantau island has many attractions to visit, with the cable car ride being one of the main attractions too. can spend the whole day there!

Tour at Lantau Island with Family. We had so much fun with our Lantau Island tour. My son enjoyed riding the cable car for the first time. We love the views from the cable car and in Big Buddha you will see the culture of Hong Kong. This should be on the list once you will be in Hong Kong :)

A Great Escape!. Some good things to do out here. We caught a ferry to Discovery Bay with its lovely beach area. The water is reasonably clean, but still a very pleasant place and a nice break from the high rise world of Hong Kong. Good restaurants and bars also.

Lovely place for relaxing . Some lovely walking trials here. The tourist attractions aren't my thing, however I guess they could be nice for families and whatnot. The cable car trip really is worth the money though. $185 return but it is honesty an amazing view, even on a cloudy day.

nice. lantau island is amazing.such a nice place to go if you want to go for a hike.you can take the ferry over..it is very green and has many restaurants bars..shops..it is a great escape from the city

Great getaway from the city . . .. This actually is reached not by boat as anticipated but by tour bus via tunnels and bridges. Nice to see the countryside and included a stop at a fishing village, visit to the very large seated Buddha, and good local lunch at the neighboring monastery. The monastery buildings and grounds were exquisite. Also, we took the tram over the hill back toward the airport which had very nice views. Well worth getting out of the city for.

Best Island. This is my favourite island of them all. You can catch a ferry to one side, walk a trail past great scenery and beaches, and then leave from another ferry pier.Also the beach is my favourite even if the power plant is an eyesore.
Thrilling Ride. i like taking a ride on the cable car to Lantau . Plenty of religious relics , temples and people to see in this place.
Beauty in this crazy city. Beautiful surrounding, quiet and a great day out. I enjoyed this lots, after 20 mins cablecaring and we saw the big buddha and this tourist street.
cable car thrill. nice exhilarating experience, especially the eats and village atmosphere and in the monsoons...romance is in the air

Love Discovery Bay. You have to try the gondola ride - great viewing. And do try to get around to Discovery Bay. You would feel like you were on vacation all the time if you lived there! Really efficient ferries.

Peace and mayhem. Lantau is big. Lots of it are quiet countryside where you can visit beautiful hills and beaches and you will be amazed at the sight of buffalos walking sedately along the roads. Outside of Tung Chung the road becomes restricted to buses, taxi ( blue ones) and local traffic. Expect huge delays at the Tung Chung bus depot on public holidays, and massive queues at Nong Ping 360 start point too. If you want to visit the citygate outlet stores, take shin guards and a big bag of patience. That spot is crammed packed with tourists all the time, but impossible to walk around on holidays. Please if you visit do not walk aimlessly around the Taste supermarket, we local folk shop there for food, and waiting 40 minutes at a check out does not help us appreciate visitors.One last little thing, the buffalo on Lantau are not paid actors, like Mickey and Minnie at disneyland. They live there and just want to have a peaceful life, so please do not let your hyper children loose on them. Take responsibility for your offspring, you made them so you should train them.Enjoy the biggest island in Hong Kong but respect those who live there all the time, human and wildlife.

Cable car ride. Take a cable car ride to this island. It is an entirely different feel from Hong Kong, away from the ever busy and rushing city. We find this place worth visiting, our first time on our 4th trip to Hong Kong.For the cable car ride, please pre-booked either through your hotel or via online. The queue to get the cable car ticket is horribly long on weekends. Otherwise, go early about 9am to get shorter queue. If your budget allows, get the crystal cable car, it has a glass floor to view below. The ride is about 40 mins, you get to see planes landing and taking off from the cable car, nice greenery. Once you get to Lantau island, you can opt to go sight seeing at the various attraction or just relax at the various shops, get some food and drink, enjoy basking and people watching. Defnitely less crowded if you get there earlier.

Escape the city and commune with nature. Conveniently located near the international airport and with an MTR station to boot, one can escape the crowded city and walk this island's nature trails. You can easily spend a day exploring this island. And when you are done, go shopping in City Gate Outlets!
Fantastic day. I would definitely recommend visiting Lantau island. You must climb those steps to visit the big Buddha .Truly amazing .

A beautiful island in Hong Kong. When you take the flight to HK,you are arriving at the LANTAU ISLAND.This is one of the best attraction for the greenery lover!The first spot manifucient TSING MA BRIDGE blends well with the beautiful costal outline.With the Park Island just beneath the bridge.It is a sole community with beaches and high/low rise residential buildings. After the Tsing Ma bridge is connecting the highway towards the airport,there is a check point called Sunny Bay (that’s an MTR stop on the pink line,just next to Disney Station) there is a recerational centre plus outdoor park for family outing.Also,in the city centre of Tung Chung (Tung Chung MTR station and this is the closest town from the airport),there is a bus terminus for routings around the Lantau Island.Suggested to go to Tai O (around 45 mins bus journey) and you’ll find another breath taking exortic fishing village in Hong Kong,which being nominted as ”Oriental Venice”.Btw,if you like,you could take the 15~20 mins cable car ride up to the mountain of Nong Ping.And do a bit hiking.Indeed,Lantau Island consist of many natural treasure and Im sure will give you an eye opening experience!

A serene and peaceful abode!. When we reached this island, it was decked in greenery and was very peaceful. viewing the Buddha was indeed a great spiritual experience. Be there to witness it.The whole experience is indeed peaceful! Loved the fantastic view and kept admiring The Buddha!
VERY NICE TRIP WITH GREAT VIEWS. A nice half day activity... Going there with the Ngong Ping Cable Car with its glass bottom. It is very well organized and the views are great.

Lots to do here especially Disney!. If you plan to go to Lantau Island one day is not enough. With the tours of walking and boat, and sunset there is so much to do! The Cable Car is awesome with great views.

Beautiful view using crystal cable car. We booked crystal cable car. Must say this was one of the best experience we had. Everyone in my family enjoyed the 35 mins ride in cable car. Cable cars takes you over the sea and forest. Strongly recommend to everyone.

Well connected with HongKong central, very close to NongPing village and Disneyland. Well connected to HongKong by train. local taxi would not take you there from Hong Kong though. Very good infrastructure, Novotel has breathtaking view of the bay and and cable to NongPing village. The ferry to and from the Tao fishing village is good too. The best part is its very close to Disneyland connected by the MTR seamlessly.

Home. I live here in Tung Chung at Caribbean Coast for five years now. Citygate Mall is billed as a discount outlet but it is not. Typical high HK prices and clothes are sized for Asians. No good Western restaurants. Lots of good hiking to Mui Wo, Tai O, and up around Buddha.

Its a must!. After a full week in the croud and loud HK city center some relaxed joirney have to be planned! Quite accessible, with MTR in 30 minutes you arrive to a really suggestable place! The big Budda and the Temple is a must see attraction!
Big budha, wisdom path. I only got chance went to the big budha, wisdom path... the weather not to good, the fog were a little bit thick, can not see the budha's face.

Holiday Break. You travel to Lantau Island by rain from Hong Kong - Your reason to go there is almost certainly to go and see the Big Buddha. However before you get there you have to go on (In my Opinion) the best Cable Car ride in the world. It Lasts 40 minutes - and to make it all the more interesting you should take one with e SEE THROUGH FLOOR - amazing. On the way up you can see a panoramic view of Hong Kong's new Airport in it's entirety.Viewing all the reclaimed land which had to be acquired for the airport. A clear view of the Planes taking off and landing at the same time. After that you have a beautiful view of all the surrounding countryside with the small buildings / houses. Breath-taking..

Great for siteseeing and hiking. My friend and I rode the cable car up to visit Lantau and see the big Buddah. It was definitely worth it. I would warn, we hiked off the back side, which is quite a trek. Be prepared if you take a hike that you know where you're going.

Plenty to do!. There's so much ch more to do here than you think with Po Lin Monastery, Ngong Ping Temple, Disneyland and more. Catching the MTR to Kowloon or Hong Kong is so easy it makes staying on Lantau a great option

More than 5 star!!!. Having a life in the city was very tiring most of the time.. So we are looking for something different.. I'm glad cause I booked this Lantau island tour.. Sea and land pass.. With Tao'O Boat.. We saw some pink Dolphins as well.. We walked to the very high stairs going up to the Big Buddha.. When u reach the top?.. Believe me it's worth it.. The view was spectacular.. I would highly recommend this attraction..
Good views.. Visited in May 2016. it was crowded and had to be in a queue for 45 minutes. A mistake of going during a week end. Experience was great. View was breathtaking.

Tai O Stilt Village - Lantau . We loved our time visiting Lantau Island. Take ferry to Mui O then bus #1 to Tai O Stilt Village (use an Octopus card for travel on MTR, ferry, bus). At Tai O take a 20 minute boat ride up the creek to see the stilt houses up close -approx 25HK Dollars. Afterwards take a walk around the stilt village to see dried fish products and temple. Lunch overlooking the river at Solo (mixed bruchetta very good). On return bus trip stop at Pui O beach (can swim and has a cafe) - we saw water buffalo on the beach! At Mui O ferry have a meal at Mui O cooked food market whilst overlooking the sea. A great day out

Stilt housing poor fishing village. Very interesting village to explore. Friendly helpful.cheerful people. Wonderful short cruise of the village and ocean looking for white Dolphins,who did not show up for us. Great clean bathroom facilities short walk from bus terminal. Well worth the adventure. Colourful market places,smells as well.

An interesting walk...... We caught the ferry from Central Piers to Sok Kwu Wan, then walked across Lantau to Yung Shue Wan, on the basis that return ferries from the latter were more frequent. The walk is reasonable, even for a couple of 70+ year olds, with plenty of opportunities for rests along the way, although some of the climbs are quite steep. We will do it again, but perhaps the other way round, as the restaurant choices for seafood seem better at Sok Kwu Wan, and the exercise gave us quite an appetite.
Must Visit Place In Hong Kong. Beautiful, Away from City, peaceful Place. Cable Car was awesome. Big Buddha and Monastery in Ngong Ping Village was Good.

My best experience. Trip to Lantau island is not to be miss if you are first timer to HOng Kong. Me and my friend really enjoy the view and cable car's ride to get to the top. Here, you can learn how the Hong Kong movie maker did the action stunts and 4D experience to Big Buddha.

A good day in the countryside. Getting to Lantau via MTR is easy. Traveling on Lantau not so easy. We could not find the bus to Tai O. I believe they are busy working on the bus terminal so its a bit confusing, so had to take a taxi. From Tai O we found a bus to Buddha and took the cable car back to MTR.
Sightseeing Spot. Cable car can be a long wait, even just to get your tickets, but something to experience. Pretty good views along the way.

Amazing island away from the city . Amazing island to visit, lots of open space, beaches and transport to most popular places in Lantau. Also have amazing hikes!!!' Perfect for a day out away from the city!! Living here is also amazing, as a current resident of Lantau island myself

Nice cable car with good view. Enjoyed my cable car ride with spectacular view from sky. Bad point here is nothing much in island itself, as such, we made a quick walk and return to cable car station.
Beautiful scenic views. This was an amazing experience and would recommend it to everyone. I'm not a fan of heights but surprisingly I was okay.

Trip To Lantau Island. We were lucky this day for our trip to Lantau island as there was hardly and queue primarily because of a rainy season. We have to get down at Tung Chung station and from here it takes 25 minutes by cable car to reach Lantau island. We could have got a excellent view had it not rained. We purchased rain coats for kid worth 40HKD and first went to Big Buddha. Its around 200 stairs climb and not that difficult. Then we went to monastery.Overall this is a half day affair and cable car journey is worth.

Varieties sights… you can spend a few days there…. There is the largest island in HK, with a mixed of city & natural scene.. the famous Buddha, Disney world, the airolport are there too. Many small islands and trekking paths are just surrounding... if you would like to tour everywhere in the LANTAU island, it may take you couple days... enjoy!
Tai O fishing village is gread. Love the place, laid back, and u really get to see Pink Dolphins. Lunch at one of the restaurant - "Wei Ni Si" was nice, though not cheap.

Beautiful place, many things to do!. Really beautiful island, 40 minutes by ferry from the metro Central, Pier 6. When you arrive to the island, there are different busses going to the main attractions of the island, it's very convenient to buy the octopus card in a metro station because these busses accept only the right amount of money, no change. The big Buddha is great, and also the little village Tai O.

Must See!. The cable car ride is spectacular with a view going up...very high up. The island is a great break from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong, and has a total sense of tranquility and inner harmony. Spend 4-6 hours since there are walking areas, and great selection of food choices. Amazing you can be in downtown Hong Kong and less than 1 hr of travel away, you will be in on an Island with several hundred years of history and tranquility.
Go to this Island. This is where you can learn a little about the Buddhist religion and visit the huge Big Buddha. It is very interesting but be respectful of others culture and beliefs.

Complete contrast to the city. We were taken to Lantau twice during our stay in HK. It's lovely. There are loads of walking trails, wildlife to see, stilt villages to explore, waterfalls to find, water buffalo to watch on beaches, and it is so peaceful. There are few cars,plenty of buses, and some great eateries. You will not believe how green and pretty this island is.So catch the ferry from Central and 40 minutes later you will see a very unexpected side to HK.

Watch out for the bulls!. The tram line is very long if tickets were not previously purchased. Crystal cars had clear floor, interesting gliding over the forest. Day was very foggy, views were limited. The facilities on Lantau Island were very interesting. We visited the Tai'O fishing village and saw the white dolphins then went to Ngong Ping village. The monastery was beautiful; unable to see the Buddha due to fog. There were some little shops, eateries and a Starbuck's. We were told the farmers left their farms and did not take their bulls with them so they wander around the village. It was a bit unnerving to see the bulls roaming around the shops. Stay out of their way!

Visited Tian Tan Buddha, Po Lin Monastery, Ngong Ping Village, 3 in 1!!!. Had a layover in HKIA for 10 hours on our way to Cebu,Philippines and got out of the airport to see Lantau Island! Best decision ever, sad we did not get to ride the Ngong Ping Cable due to scheduled maintenance but we took a cab there and got to see the island from a different vantage point. The Big Buddha lived up to its name, it was huge and towered the island. The view from the top was spectacular and very peaceful! Cows roam freely everywhere and dogs too! The Po Lin Monastery's architecture was inspiring and it was very quiet and peaceful, really good for meditating (with lots of flowers and plants everywhere). The view from the top was really my favorite, the looming mountains shrouded in mist was magical. You need to be a bit fit to climb the steps though but worth it! Getting in and out of the island by taxi was relatively easy and so was getting in and out of the airport. Going through immigration was smooth and efficient.
Cable Car ride was worth it. The Lantau islands offering an awesome view, connected by the cable car, can see the HK Airport. Overall once visit!

A must visit. A great place to cover in 3 hours!
Temples and a big Buddha statue, places to pray and souvenirs shops and eating shops are there!
Very quiet and good place to take pictures too!
Mesmerising . Went to island through rope way. Beautiful experience. It is the longest rope way in the world and you can see HK airport very close by.

30 mins cable car ride, then a stunning place. The first thing you would see on the cable car ride is the airport, however when it rains, visibility gets low and the windows turn white.Once there, you can get to various places and even get a fishing village tour(see dolphins)

Go on a clear visible weekday. This attraction forms part of the village Nping 360 and the Big Buddha. All together, it's an amazing place to go. Our round trip on the cable car was in a crystal cabin whereby you can see through a glass floor at a hight of circa 500m (?). It was for me the best thing about Hong Kong. Going up in the cable car (15 minute trip I'd say one way), seeing what I think is the most beautiful monastery together with the beautiful scenery with cooler climate (5 degrees less than ground level at least which is so pleasant). You can even see the planes taking off as it's next to the airport from the cable car. Cannot rate this place high enough.

head to the big buddha then come back to shop. head here for the big buddha if you set out early you can then have time to shop. There are outlet stores for burberry and coach here and a few others, even adidas and nike. there a food opera at the top of the mall and close to the MTR to head back to the city.

A "Must-See", spend a whole day 'touring'. We were here on an Optional Excursion, tour by Gate1. Though we've been in HK about 8 times, this was our first time ever out to Lantau Island - primarily because it would take up the whole day. or most of it. We were happy that we did. Lots of great sights, one of the few fishing villages left, and of course, the Big Buddha and the monastery!Lantau means ‘Rotten head’, which refers to the way the hills looked like, after the “Great Clearance” and people eventually returned in 1669. Five villages were subsequently resettled: Tai O, Tung Sai Chung, Lo Pui O, Shek Pik and Mui Wo. There are Chinese white dolphins, sometimes called pink dolphins, water buffaloes, and a “5-star” prison, where prisoners have tennis courts, etc. Sounds like our Gitmo prison! You know how we have our “Deer Crossing” or “Watch out for Deer” signs? They’ve got similar ones, only “Watch out for Cattle”. These were cows that escaped when the land was being developed and have multiplied. We saw at least 5 of them, and they could be in the middle of the road!First stop was at Cheng Sai (“Long Sand”) Beach. Beautiful area, nice sandy beach, relatively unknown, and we even saw some crabs scurrying around in the sand after the tide went out. Water was relatively warm, and because it was a Friday, it was not crowded at all - and not that well known, even among HK residents.. Some residents use this as a ‘Staycation’. Next was Tai O, a fishing village with traditional houses on stilts. You can see the businesses, selling all sorts of interesting food stuff (mostly sea), and in the back or upstairs is the residence, storage area, etc. Some of the interesting food items, mostly dried were: Fish gills, cuttlefish, various shrimps and scallops, starfish, and fish. From our local tour guide, if residents were anywhere close to the island, they bought their seafood here!We also entered a monastery and took a look around. NOTE: I am skipping photos of the Tai O fishing village, as I noticed that it is separately reviewed by TripAdvisor. <=====Then it was onto the Giant Buddha, 85-foot (26 m)-high bronze Tian Tan Buddha statue, once the world's largest seated outdoor bronze Buddha statue, and is only part of the Po Lin Monastery. We did not walk up the 268 steps to the top of the Giant Buddha. We then came down, crossed the Mall of Heroes, which consisted of 12 Divine Generals in China history, each one having a birthday in one of the Chinese astrological symbols.We then went to the Po Lin Monastery restaurant for a vegetarian lunch – all the dishes were tasty! And quite a bit of difference from the Shanghai and Beijing food we’ve been having! We then went into the Po Lin Monastery and in the back of that building was the Grand Hall of Ten Thousand Buddhas. I will have to take their word for it, since I didn’t count them all.Then it was finally time to go back to Kowloon and our hotel. We took the Ngong Ping 360 Cable Car, but it was the Standard cable car, not the Crystal (glass bottom) cable car. It travelled about 7 kilometers, which took 20-25 minutes or so, and we could see quite a bit of the areas all around us, as well as below.All in all, it was a very good and worth-while trip and if you've got the day, this is a great place to spend it!
Quite far but worth it. As its an island you have to go through whole hong kong also, if you take Cable ride opt for crystal cabin it have the perfect view.overall its a good experience for me

So close but yet so far. Although it's just a few miles from the thick of Hong Kong, Lantaus retains both a pleasantly suburban feel in parts and an outright country flavor elsewhere. It's stretches of unspoiled beaches and thickly forested hills seem remarkably at odds with the city of millions just next door.
for fun and retreat holidays. it's a good time for retreat, to unwind through sight-seeing.Usually bestt for camping and mountain climbing.

Island surprise. A visit on a rainy day limits exploration of the little towns on the island, but adds authenticity to the small fishing villages. Take a fast ferry to the island, explore the road network by bus, hop on and off at different stops, engage the people and leave with some memorabilia.
Part of the Budda experience,. Many years ago, Lantau Island was only by ferry, and not a lot to see, now completely different, it is good to see.

An amazing experience and a very memorable ride. This cable car journey to Lantau Island is as equally memorable as Disney Land trip in Hong Kong. This is almost 20 mnts ride over sea, hills and a vally side. The best part is the crystal cabins which will have a see through base and the experience to watch the valley and the sea deep is just amazing. It is recommended to opt for crystal cabin though it would cost bit more than the normal cabin. If possible, book it though in advance through your travel agent so as you don't have to waste time by standing in long queue for tickets as the agents ticket entry has pass through..

Wonderful visit. Do not miss it. We visited this great place via MTR and we had a great time..do not miss it. At the begining I was reluctant but as the journey progressed I was greatly impressed. We did it on a sunday and perhaps more visitors than on a work day but it was worth every minute every dime. The trip via subway no problem at all. Getting there very easy. The cable car ride fabulous!!! One of the best cable car rides ever. Beats Table Mountain at Cape Town. What a scenery. What a site. Do it ...do not miss it. And at the MTR base in Lantau there is a shopping mall and there a great japanease restaurant with great food. Great service and very very fresh. A must do trip.

Serene and scenic. The cable car ride up to lantau island was really beautiful , relaxing and amazing scenic views .. the Po Lin temple is a beautiful architecture and we would always take the bus ride to Tai O.

Fantastic. Well worth the visit, we went by ferry and it took an hour, then caught a bus of around 20 mins ride, all done on the Octopus card ! amazing, lovely shops and history to the island, well worth a visit.
Must visit and should be on top of list. This should be on the top of list. Straight to Tun Chung station ----> Cable carCable car -----> Lantau islandBreathtaking views will welcome you.

Easy to navigate on your own. Don't worry about getting here from Kowloon or Hong Kong island, it is quite easy to do on your own. Plan on 5-6 hours roundtrip and an additional 2-3 hours if you also go to Tai O fishing village or do some hiking in the area. From Kowloon take the MTR (orange line) to Tung Chung station and follow the crowd. The cable car terminal is just as you exit the MTR station. I would suggest pre-purchasing tickets on line to avoid the ticket line and they were cheaper. You will still have to stand in line for the cable car. You may want to check the website the night before, we discovered that the cable car would be closed for maintenance and then researched which bus to take instead. The bus terminal is a 5 minute walk past the cable car terminal, take bus 23. We went early, beat the crowds and the heat. Be aware that the cable car opens earlier than Big Buddha (which opens at 10). There is supposed to be some great hiking in the area, which we did not do. Instead, we took the 21 bus from the Big Buddha to Tai O fishing village and spent a few hours in the fishing village walking the streets and took a boat cruise to see the stick houses and also saw some pink dolphins. From Tai O you can take a bus all the way back to the MTR station. All in all a busy but lovely day trip!
Nice scenery. Great area, beautiful scenery. Nice trekking paths, though not for everyone, especially in hot days.

Great . Please make the trip to Lantau Island. My favorite was the cable car ride and the spectacular views. We walked around the grounds and climbed the stairs to Buddha. There are several souvenir shops and eateries. If we had more time, I would've loved to hike around Lantau Island.

Nice quiet place for trekking.. Trekking is not for the faint hearted, do it early when it is not too hot. Wooden steps are done for trekkers. Beside big buddha, can take bus to stanley area for a leisure walk and dining.
Cable Car Ride. I think it was a very long Cable Car Ride that i've ever ride before and it was very worthy. you'll see the airport from it and also the landscape of Lantau Island.

Home of the Big Buddha. Great experience visiting the Big Buddha the past couple of times. A definite must see during your visit to Hong Kong. Whether you take the cable cars or decide to hike up the Island it's a worthwhile treat.

"Great place". Whenever you're in Hong Kong, it should be on your bucket list. So many things to explore here and riding a cable car is just the start of your awesome adventure here. You can go to Disneyland and side trip to Ngong ping village to see the famous giant Buddha.

Wow. Wow. This is what said from mid way in the air on see-through bottom of the roadway cube. A picture perfect journey. If you are scared of heights, better not to chose see-through glass floor cube. If you are not sure, I’d recommend to go for it …

What a great surprise. We decided to move here to be closer to the airport for our final day.From our hotel we got the shuttle bus to Tung Chung bus terminal and train station. This is next door to the cable car (Ngong Ping) that will take you to see the seated bronze Buddah....... one of the largest in the world. The ride is 5.7 KMs and spectacular.A tip.... you will be offered standard ride or crystal floor ride ( where you can see through the floor as you ascend and descend) It seems that the standard queue moves faster than the crystal if you are in a hurry.Up the top you can also walk to a monastery.The ride back is also spectacular.Next day we took the bus to Tai O. Bus leaves from the same area at Tung Chung train station..... just walk towards the cable car area.One hour trip on the bus to a lovely fishing village. We got there at 10 am and everything was closed except for a few shops. This was GOOD. We walked through the village and by the time we returned things were humming so we could eat, buy souvenirs and catch the bus back without a long wait.
Awsome. Lantau island is a must visit place in hongkong.its better you purchase the ticket from hotel or other tourist dealer because there will be a big que to buy ticket for npong360 cable car.
Lots to see here. Disneyland is here so although small, well worth a visit. Then there is the Big Buddha, Ngong Ping Cable car and the Outlet Centre at Tung Chung.

Incredible place. I love this Island, from the starting point where you need to take cabinet,The view is nice and the cabinets are nice where you can see what is under your feet from cabinet bcs its is transparent. Love it and there is a long way down where some people walk along.The view is amazing. in this island there is a fishing village where you can rent the boat and see dolphins ans see the simple life of people and you go by bus.There are fish restaurant in the fishing village.

Tall buildings.... The largest of the islands in Hong Kong.Amazingly huge number of tall buildings.It houses the Hongkong International Airport too.You will surely visit this place on your way to Ngong Ping Buddha.Rtn.J.Ganesh

Awesome day. It's a must-visit place for travellers especially first-timers. Take the glass cabin if you are not afraid of height.
Worth to go!

Buy Tickets Online. You could skip the long line by buying the tickets online. Didn't try the glass cabin but if you're not afraid of heights you can ride this one. One ride is about 30 minutes so it was worth the long wait
Great place for a hike. Went there to get away from HK stress its a small island but a great place for a 2 hour hike from side to side. Great seafood and small beaches that are great place to relax.

Nature around Hong kong. It was nice to see some natural environment worth a visit even for the cable car ride
We spent the day walking around and our daughters friends walked up to the Bug Buddha so its perfect for all ages and activity levels
Nice view (on a clear day). I would not rave about it as the only thing interesting is the ride.Once up there,it is just another shopping mall. The big Buddha is not that old,it's just big...

Be sure to buy tickets online. . Please buy tickets beforehand online. There are great online package deals and you avoid the horrendous queue. It has become rather touristy with lots of mainland Chinese tourists. I would recommend going on a weekday to avoid the mad rush. Go to the monastery and have local vegetarian food and traditional snacks. It was a nice afternoon which brought back childhood memories.
Amazing view. This is one of the best ways to connect to this island. View is outstanding and you'll definitely love to get this ride on your way back.

Truly Magnificent. Visited Lantau Island with my family during my visit to HongKong. This should be top in the list while visiting HongKong. While HongKong is a big modern city, Lantau is a very calm and tranquil island. There are beautiful mountains and good view of the South China Sea. Those who love nature should visit this beautiful island.The cable car ride to Ngong Ping is absolutely amazing. I would suggest to take the cable car one way and to take the bus while returning. Its also a very good experience. While in Lantau, the best places to visit are the famous Tian Tan Budha, Po Lin Monastery, wisdom path and the Tai O village. For hikers, there are some beautiful trails which can be explored if you have time. Not to forget that Disneyland is also in Lantau Island
Peacful nice beach. Very peaceful and nice beach. Great for family day on the beach. The ferry is a bit long but interesting if the weather is good

a very different experience of Hong Kong. Took the "Ngong Ping 360 package" which include cable car, Po Lin temple, Tai O fishing village. The package is suitable for 1st timer who wanted to have an overall idea of Lantau island, as it is convenient. Ngong Ping village though is touristy and "artificial" but pretty. Do try the "Taufufa" in Po Lin temple, it is very smooth and delicious!

A one of a kind esperience. This visit was the best for my husband me and three friends couples, the cable car is a very save, high and long one. The eight of us believe was the number ONE attraction in HK. Some tips: buy the ticket without crystal in the floor (the crystal is expensive and not worth it) but the package is KEY (include the bus and the boat) but the most important for a Sunday or Saturday is that you get the fast pass for the return. Which you request at the holiday store when you comeback, You have to check the 21 bus to go to the fishing village so that you go right thre if the bus is ready, then see the buda when come back.In the 360 motion stores don't forget to use your 20HK$ it is very convenient you can accumulate them.
A great day. An amazing trip. The guide was exceptional. All of the people involved with the excursion were very professional. I would recommend it to anyone.

Hong Kong highlight. The cable car trip was fantastic but the weather closed in and we couldn't see the Big Buddha. Overall, Lantau Island was a very pleasant day trip. We took the ferry over and then caught the bus to the cable car station, rode the train back to HK

Magnificent view, nice ride on air-lift tram. Enjoy a quiet afternoon at Ngong ping 360. Some of us may find it a bit costly spending us$23 (return)for 5.7 km air-lift tram ride.To me, I certainly recommend it because the fee is not high comparing to the counterpart else where in the world but u not to choose the "glass floor type uf u are aftaid of height.There is delicious fast food in the peak and you must see the "bog Buddhist" statute. If u aren't budget tight, paying $27 more for a package to Tai-O fishing village on top of 36 0 is good. The fish village is a great attraction.

The Big Buddha and Po Lin Monastery. The Big Buddha and Po Lin Monastery site amazing to visit, easy access from city on MTR to Tung Chung Station Exit B, then take Ngong Ping Cable Car, which takes around 30 minutes, excellent view !!!

Half day is enough. There's nothing much to experiece in Lantau Island, especially when there's only the Big Buddha village on top. On top, there's even a line of shops built for business, nothing more.

Beautiful Island. We went on a bus tour of Lantau Island - we were not really sure of what to expect but were not disappointed. As well as visiting the big Buddha and Po Lin Monastery (reviewed separately) we were taken to Cheung Sha Beach. A beautiful beach with no-one on it because of lack of access. Although certain parts of the island have been developed (mainly the airport) this site has not. My husband was quick to kick off his shoes and get his feet into the South China sea (I was in the meantime rescuing a stick insect that I found in the toilets, ha ha). We also visited the Tai O fishing village - wow, this was pretty interesting. The guide said it was not touristy and smelt of fish and he was right. All sorts of things for sale there and very atmospheric. Well worth the visit.The best thing of all though was the sky rail Cable Car. We caught it back at the end of the tour. It was a 25 minute 5.7km trip of panoramic awesomeness. You must do this. You can either go in a glass car or a regular one. We went in a regular one but on hindsight a glass one would've added an extra level of....what, perhaps fear? Lots of photo opportunities here, it was truly wonderful. The views were mostly not blue sky views at the time of year we were there, in May, but still very spectacular.

Run's very efficiently and Quick to board.. Nice Cable car to the top where there is a big Budda. Weather was drizzly so car gets very cold and windy (shakes) noting crazy. Visibility was awful so it was like driving blindly as you couldn't see more then 2 feet in front of you.
Super Scenic. Blessed with Nature, Lantau Island is one of the Best and Super Scenic place in Hong Kong. Tourist must visit Lantau to experience it's beauty.

Cable Car - Closed for Maintenance. Visited in March and cable car was closed.Used a regular bus service that was OK but required exact cash amounts, no change given by driver.Our party was very disappointed and perhaps we should have checked before hand.

Weather might play spoil sport. Big Buddha is the high point of Lantau Island - the same one where the Hong Kong airport is located. We went there directly from the Airport as we landed early morning and had a 3pm check in. There is a luggage storage facility in the airport for HKD12 per hour. It is priced according to the number of pieces of luggage. We dumped our suitcases there and took a bus to Tung Chung - a few minutes away. This is where the cable car station is. We took the cable car up and had great views of the airport and the new highway to Macau that is being constructed. We had a good view of Buddha on the way up, but as we got to the stairs it started pouring and we had to turn back.

Best place in HKG. I'm kinda different from others. I don't really go for shopping mall or best foods while travelling HKG. However, I find this little small fish village has something call peacefulness. No rushing, no crowd, unsophisticated and simple life. It's pity that I didn't get to arrange for another day staying here. But Lantau Island, I'll definitely come back soon.

Cut the super long queue with online ticket or voucher. I came in May and the weather is cloudy. there was 2 super long queue, first line to buy the cable car ticket and second line to enter cable car. since i already buy the ticket in klook, i skip the first line and save the time. 1 standard cabin cable car filled with 8 adult + 2 child (max capacity: +/- 17 person). the trip was super smooth and the scenery was great... mountain, airport, etc. if you want to use cable car, better check the website first to see maintenance schedule.

Must Visit!. We loved our trip to Lantau Island. Every part about it is fun - the long trolley ride, the lush green mountains, the peace on the island, and the cobblestone pathways. Do allocate sufficient time, at least a full day, when you visit.

Active Construction. We took the ferry to Lantau to have lunch. Unfortunately, there was lots of construction going on. It will be nice when finished, but for now the view of the small harbor is blocked for quite a ways.

Great day trip exploring Lantau island. My husband and I enjoyed a great day exploring Lantau island. We highly recommend paying a bit extra for the transparent floor gondola as it definitely adds a kick to your trip up the mountain to meet the Big Buddha. After we took a bus over to Tai O, a small fishing village with cute stilt houses and local delicacies at the market. Lantau island offers fun activities for adults and families alike.

Breathtaking views from the cable car. Love my trip to Lantau Island. I love the scenery from the Ngong Ping 360 cable car, its really worth to take a ride.Near the Ngong Ping Piazza, there is a seller selling a very yummy Tofu fa (Sweet warm tofu pudding)

Worth the visit. I used one of the local tour companies for a day visit to the island and the family had fun.Took the cable ride to the Buddha statue and on a clear day the ride is beautiful.They have a hike trail for the hikers.something to do for the next trip.Monastery at the top provides a vegetarian meal.Then went to the fishing village and took a boat ride to the South China Sea to spot some pink Dolphins.Was a day well spent at the island.

Great view and beautiful journey. A great way to spend a day. Do take the Crystal Car, it is slightly more expensive and way better. Also do carry your passport as you can avoid long lines if you are an international traveller

Journey by Roapway to view 360* scenary is wonderful & unique.One must enjoy it.. Markets at Big Buddha place are filled with gift shops & eatables.Actually this place is a worship place & many buddhist prey there to fulfill their dreams.
Family fun. Very nice place peaceful !! Try the veg resturant inside the monastery also be ready to walk a bit specially on a sunny ft it would be difficult

nice getaway from the city. I took the cable car as opposed to the bus. I was told that the buses tend to be very crowded and you might not be able to get a seat. The big Buddha is located on the island.

The Fishing Village. On arriving at the Village we saw the old houses built over the water , The fishing boats, fish drying racks,fish markets were there to inspect.In the middle of it all was an amazing bakery that served traditional cooking and some of the most tasty cakes and nut bars I have ever tasted .Well worth visiting.

the rope way in the sky... One thing one must do in Hongkong if you have extra time is take a half day trip to Lantau Island. The ride on the cable car itself is so beautiful. Then you get to see the Big Buddha... al other attractions are rubbish like the village trip, and fishing village to watch dolphins etc.. no dolphins in the sea actually and waste of time

GREAT EXPERIENCE. went here with husband and we ride crystal cable car to get here its kinda scary but it was really awesome as we could see lovely views. Although it was humid and rainy when we visited the place we still enjoyed it as we are able to see the beauty of the island. unfortunately, we wasn't able to see the big buddha clearer as it was foggy that time but we had fun walking up 268 steps to get to top. really great experience ^_^ will surely return to see the big buddha again. ^_^

Great for an afternoon trip.. We visited Lantau in late April. The cable car ride was a riot because of the wind that day but really enjoyed the views of the airport in the way up. When we arrived it was foggy but we could see everything we needed to but with restrictions. Its well organised and obviously very touristy. Long queues to take cable car back down. Would recommend it for a good family day out.

Big Buddha and Tai O. We got there by bus - regular service and didn't cost much. The queue for the cable car was about an hour, so I'd advise booking at least a day in advance if you want to do that. The big Buddha is very impressive, from there you can get a bus out to Tai O which is a nice little fishing village with a bunch of shops and food stalls. When we went it was pretty calm compared to Hk so was a nice afternoon out.
Help !!!!!!. I'm coming go Hong Kong for a week in July 2016 and need an apartment with kitchen near Disney landM

Best day in HK. ...it was the day I had the trip in Lantau. We got here by ferry and then took a bus. The island is a wonderful place, with lush vegetation covered (unfrotunately all the time during our trip) with mists. I took the Lantau Trail from the Garden of Wisdom, hoping to "conquer" theLantau Peak, but gave up very near of the end. Just because the mist, that made dificult to return. However, the island itself is beautiful and from the bus we saw beaches and forests that made us to want to come back sometime in ghe future and to stay more
Cable Car trip. Great cable car trip - fantastic views, good way to get to The Big Buddha. Get there early - even at 10.00 when it opened we had to queue 45 minutes.

Rustic getaway. There is much to see and do on Lantau Island. Besides Disneyland and the Ngong Ping Cable Car and Big Buddha, you can also visit Tai O, a little fishing village which will take you decades back in time.

Great diversion from the city to experience Chinese culture in a serene setting.. Take the cable car and experience amazing city views on your way to visit the largest Buddha in the world. Although seeing the buddha is wonderful, it's a treat to people watch the devoted and tourists alike. There is an area where people light incense... 5 foot tall incense, beautiful to observe. If you walk down the trail PAST the Buddha, you will come upon giant wooden monoliths carved with Chinese prayers in a mystical mountain setting. One of the best things we did on our trip.
Worth a visit. Great views from the cable car ride and worth the steps to make it up to the giant Buddha. There is a small town at the top where you can buy souvenirs as well.

Big buddha. We visited Lantau island early in the morning and climbed up to the foot of the giant Buddha, the mist was just rising from the Islands in the sea and it was magical. Lovely peaceful place also visited the beautiful colour temple. Well worth the visit. Easy to get to via the MTR and bus, or the cable car if you are feeling brave. We came back to HK via a high speed ferry, very quick and efficient
nice quiet place. A nice quiet island, totally different from the rest of Hong Kong, a very good idea for a day trip with some old fishing villages and the giant Buddha as highlights.

More than just Big Buddah. The cable car to Ngong Ping is lovely - book tickets in advance to avoid queues (we queued for about 25 minutes). Ngong Ping Village has been developed into a typical tourist area with shops selling lots of souvenirs and cheap tat. There are lots of fast food options too including Subway and Starbucks so it doesn't feel particularly special when you arrive, but when you get past all that and climb the steps to Big Buddah it really hits you how special this area is. Po Lin Monastery is absolutely beautiful too.From Ngong Ping Village you can get the 21 bus to Tai O fishing village. Here you can get a boat ride around all the stilt houses and around the coast in search for dolphins. A 20 minute boat ride only cost HK$25 (about £2.20). You can walk through the village with all the tiny local shops and out onto the stilt houses where some of the locals have set up small restaurants and bars. Visit Julia in Triple Lanterns Cafe in the middle of the stilt houses for a very warm welcome and truly incredible views.You can get another bus to Mui Wo to catch a ferry back to Central.
Lantau. Just watching it from taxis window, but it looks interesting place. High hills, forests and big budha.
Fun for weekend. Great activity to do after visiting the big Buddha. Great to see fishing village as part of site seeing. Take the local bus as it is cheap and wellOrganized.

Visit to the Buddha felt like "Disneyland" . The cable car trip was pleasant and it was good to see that there is some lovely countryside in the Hong Kong area for hiking, but the trip to the big Buddha was a waste of time unless you enjoy places like "Disneyland". The temple and the Buddha lacked authenticity.
Great day out. Nice long cable car route up to Buddha and monastery. Learnt a great deal. Nice places to eat at the top

Great Views. A must do when in Hong Kong! You get to see some great views from the cable car. But be sure to go on a day when the weather is clear or you will be disappointed. When we went back from seeing the Buddha it started raining and becoming cloudy which spoils everything!

Lush vegetation and wonderful tourist activities. Lantau Island can be reached on the MTR and then using busses to visit different areas. Using an OCTUPUS card makes it easy to get there. It is possible to take the cable car to the top to see the Tian Tan Buddha. There is a charge for the cable car: a regular card or a crystal card allowing the chance to see the vegetation through the glass floor. It is, also, possible to walk the entire way to the top or to the bottom and enjoy the lush vegetation on the way.There is a bus to the Tai O village where the houses are on stilts. There is another bus to the Tian Tan Buddha from Tai O.If you want a day of nature, this is a good choice.

Getaway from the city. I believe this island is well known for having Ngong Ping 360 cable car, Big Buddha, Hong Kong Disneyland and Tai O fishing village. I have checked out the cable car and the Big Buddha but not Tai O fishing village and the Disneyland. Perhaps can explore both places in future.

Worth a visit . Took the cable ride to & fro (25 min ride each) & we got to see nice scenery including the mountains, HK airport, sea & the big buddha. Enjoyed the wind at the high mountains as well as Tai O boat ride. For those going during rainy or cold weather, do wear thicker jackets.

Lantau Island. Lantau island is a ferry or MTR ride away from Central. HK DIsney, The Big Buddha, Tai O fishing village, and other attractions are on Lantau. Discovery Bay and Mui Wo are two quiet villages on Mui Wo popular with expats. DB has the beautiful Auberage hotel, excellent internal bus system, shopping and dining at two plazas, and a nice beach.

Cool trip, must see. Close to the outlet mall :)Queue for the tickets is awful.But I am sure, you will enjoy the trip in the cable cabin with the glass bottom. If there is nice weather - not always foggy as we had :)

Worth a visit . Lantau Island is worth a visit if you want to escape the ordinary city life. The island offers different spots like the fishing village in Tai O or the Big Buddha. It may get crowded over the weekend, so if you are a tourist travel to Lantau over the week.

Great ride and awesome views over Hong Kong airport. The cable car ride is very popular so expect to wait in line for about an hour each end. However if you are on vacation it doesn't matter as you have all the tine in the world.The ride is about 25 to 30 mins in each direction and if you are an aviation enthusiast the views over Hong Kong airport are spectacular. Make sure you take your good camera.

Gone downhill. I know it is easy to say everything was better in the old days but in this case it was!. I went about 15 years ago before the MTR went out there and you had to get a ferry and then walk up to the Buddha. Now you arrive into a fake Chinese village with American food stores and are channeled through that to the Buddha and temple. The area around the temples seem to have been modernised and there are hordes of people which I suppose is to be expected if they have improved the transport links. Could just be me moaning but not as fun as I remember it.

Tourists in the Mist. We decided that the Buddha and Lantau Island were high on our list of things to do whilst in Hong Kong. Unfortunately the weather wasn't kind to us - we queued for an hour to see .... fog. When we got to the island we saw more fog. Oh and we managed to see the Buddha's feet, which as feet go, were very nice feet. In all seriousness we had a wail of a time and the foggy weather has simply provided us with some brilliant dinner party stories. There is loads to do there, and I would recommend at least half a day if you can't manage the whole day. We didn't bother getting the crystal cabin (by this point we had seen enough fog to last a lifetime) but if the weather had been good then we would have done. Make sure you get there early, we arrived around 1pm and had to queue for an hour for our fog-filled adventure to start.
A different experience. We had looked forward to it but as it was raining, we were unable to see much. It has become a bit too touristy for us. The food was costly and not quite worthwhile.

Not to be missed !. Beautiful island and gives u a great day break from the hustle & bustle of HK. Very easy to get there by MTR ( metro ) and 30 min ride with funicular is pleasant & calm. Island itself if very pretty with no pollution. Special feeling seeing the Big Buddah and walking around puts you in good frame of mind. If you have time ( about 4 hours needed ) get the bus from BB and go to nearby fishing village, allows you to see a more natural side of HK as sooo many shopping malls & sky scrapers in Hong Kong can be a bit overwhellming.

A nice change from the usual impression of Hong Kong. Lantau Island is roughly 3 times the size of Hong Kong Island. It has an extensive area of greens with a big varieties of insects and plants. Places like Tai O, Mui Wo, Cheung Sha, Pui O are still full of the colours of the old Hong Kong when it was a small fishing village. Lantau provides a lot of hiking trails along which you might run into families of the original residents -- cattle. You can enjoy the fine sand of Cheung Sha and Tong Fuk in the summer months.Enjoy the cable car ride from Tung Chung to Ngong Ping where you can visit the Big Buddha and the Po Lin Temple which serve Chinese vegetarian food. I cannot explain everything there is to see on Lantau in just a few lines. But if you are tired of the shopping malls and commercial area of the fast-paced and crowded HK Island and Kowloon Peninsula, head to Lantau Island for a change of atmosphere and, fresh air. You can reach Lantau Island either by ferry or MTR.

Must Do. this is certainly a must visit for anyone going to Hong Kong. I would recommend at least half a day to a whole day trip to the island as there is a lot to see. You can take the MTR to the end of the track on the island and from there the cable cars are easily accessible. The cable cars journey is long and pretty high up. you have a choice of a normal cabin or a crystal glass cabin, which is not recommended if you are not comfortable with heights. the journey takes at least 15-20 mins to get to the top of the mountain and it is a pleasant ride with a lot of photo opportunities. When you get to the top you land in the village from which the buddha and the monastery are a short walk away. there are a few restaurants and cafes open but they close as soon as the cable cars close for the day which is around 6:00pm. i would suggest getting there early as the queue to get off the mountain is a long one. it was certainly my best experience of Hong Kong and a great day out.
Loved the Budda in the mist. Rode the cable car to Lantau. Great views and experience. Fog descended on the giant Budda creating a wonderful effect.

Lantau Island. Easy connection by MTR. Better to book teleferic cars ticket online.. Otherwise you can find you self long waiting line.. The views are amazing. There are few places arond the world such experience.. I suggest all travel to visit there.. Nice cafe , restaurants for shor pitstop..
Highlight of 3 day visit. An escape from the madness of honk jong. Enjoyed the cable car ride to the budda, the fihing villages and the awesome secnery.
bring your camera!!. The views are amazing!! Great place for shots with the camera. Don't forget to look down and see the amazing steps and people attempting to hike its grounds.

A nice change from the city, worth a day in itself. It's the Wandering Yank here. Mrs. Yank and I had spent a couple of days in Kowloon and Hong Kong Island, and we were ready for a break from the urban experience. We wanted to see the Big Buddha (see my review), so took the MTR out to Lantau, took the gondola (fantastic!) up to Ngong Ping and the Buddha, then took a bus to Tai O, then another bus back to the MTR station. Whew! But it was well worth it. Great views, lots of nature, and a variety of things to do and see. And it's very easy to get to with the MTR.2 thumbs up!
beautiful, awesome,. lush green place, calm quiet & away from the concrete jungle. A must visit.Can be reached by MTR right in front of the Ngong Ropeway / Cable car station.

Visit Ngong Ping and Tai o village. Alight at Tung Chung MTR station. Walk to cable car station to go Ngong Ping. Queue can be very long on weekends. Another option is to take a bus from the bus terminals. Tai O village can be reached via bus.

Many reasons to visit. Lantau Island is easy to get to and perfect for a day trip. There are interesting shops with a bit of a hippy feel to them. Good coffee and wonderful Chinese seafood restaurants. Good beaches too. Take your swimmers and make a day of it.

Beautiful and relaxing. Been here twice and still love it! The first time we went up on the normal cable car, the second time we took the crystal glass cabin which was quite an experience. It was scary at first seeing as we're standing on glass and looking down at either the sea or forest but we soon got used to it and were able to sit down on the glass cabin floor to take photos.Ngong Ping village is scenic and relaxing. There are many shops in the area but be sure to visit the tea house, Li-Nong Tea House, and enjoy a nice smooth bean curd in one of the small eateries on the way to the Big Buddha.
Wonderful. A must go place. Amazing nature from car cables although it was foggy.Nice walk within nature. You have to try reaching Lantau peak.
visit the Buddah. bit wet when we went but get the MTR from Central, and then the cable car to the village and the walk up to the Buddah, almost a must do in hong kong
Fantastic . You can get up the island by either cable car or bus. Fresh air, above the clouds is just breath taking. Go early to avoid the queues

Disney. Disney was great. no lines, good food, and fun for our grandchild. The MTR took us right to the door. It was raining part of the time but enough indoor things to go to while we waited for the rain to stop

Scenic and Peacefull. It was well worth the trip over on the ferry from Kaloon.What a contrast from the hustle and bustle of Kaloon.It has so much history.A trip to the monastery and to see the big Budda is a must.We had an enjoyable vegitarian meal in the Monastery.
Tourist trap, but well worth a visit. Cable cars are pretty cool, you get a pretty nice view of Lantau and also the airport (sounds cooler than it is) Also, the big buddha is worth a look!

Catch the bus and explore . So much to do with little hide away locations as well. The Big Buddha is there as well as the cable car. Great transport as well. In Tung Chung is a factory outlet citygate shopping centre too. Small beaches line the coast line as well.I recommend reviewing the bus routes and linking your day to this. It ensures you can get around and most importantly, find your way back. Octopus card is a must for all transport. Great place to explore and unwind

Amazing Contrast to Hong Kong City. It's hard to believe that this is Hong Kong. I stayed in a small village (Silver Mine Beach) and I felt like I was 1000 miles away from downtown Hong Kong. Many great places to get away from the business of Hong Kong, yet closely connected by ferry, even to the East side which has no MTR service.

The calm peaceful side of Hong Kong. Compared to the island of Hong Kong or Kowloon area, Lantau island is a place where you can catch a breathe, hike up a mountain, play on the beaches, visit quieter villages.Transport: MTR to various stations. Tung Chung Station - which takes you to the Ngong Ping 360 cable carFerry - Central Pier to Mui Wo Pier. From Mui Wo there are buses that takes you to different parts of the island (such as Tai O, Shek bi reservoir), good way to reach different sections of the Lantau hiking trail. Taking the ferry and bus is definitely way cheaper than the cable car but you need to know which stops to get off and you miss the aerial view of Hong Kong from the cable car.Definitely worth half-day to a whole day's visit

Great way to spend a few hours. Went up with my wife on a somewhat rainy/foggy day and it was excellent. It didn't end up raining up there so the queue for the cable cars wasn't very long. We spent maybe 3 hours walking around and seeing everything there--it was great!

A mystical journey to Buddha (Po Lin Monastery). Just getting there is a delight, you get to go on the train and see the beautiful country side, then you soar in a Cable car (be sure to get the one with the glass floor), and wen you get there you can only marvel at the site. It takes at leas an hour trek to get to the top, and though all of it you just get more and more things to cherish wen you are done. You get to go to see monastery with all its splendors, marvel at the majestic size of this Buddha, and have an unbelievable day! Remember to say a prayer en leave some incense!

Cable car experience is fabulous . I visited Hong Kong for Saturday and Sunday and was told that the cable car to Big Buddha is a must try. It took almost 6 hours or little more for this trip from Causeway Bay and return. The cable car experience is real good. We took the car with crystal bottom and the view was too good down...the sea, the forest and later the clouds- everything was amazing. I would call it kind of adrenaline rushing. The view of the airport island is also very good - the areal view of the airport and the flights taking off, landing is amazing. Finally the Big Buddha and the weather at the top is amazing... There were clouds but still it was breathtaking... Fabulous. I would strongly recommend.

Different Hong Kong Life style in Display. Lantau, you can get there by MTR or buses, depends on which part of Hong Kong that you are coming from, takes around 45 minutes to an hour.Cable car and Big Buddha are two main attractions. There is Citygate outlet shopping to shop.Restaurant selection is limited.You can also catch a bus to go to Discovery Bay, more like a westerner village.Overall you can experience all sort of Hong Kong lifestyle in Lantau.

Lovely views, lunch with monks. Honestly, I keep going back. It is fun, the souvenir shops are actually freak (Peking opera has the best good luck tassel charms anywhere), and the vegetarian lunch that supports the monks is tasty. The views going to the seated Buddha are spectacular...the cable car is the way to go as the bus ride can be nausea inducing.

Fake but Fun. Just like the pyramids of Giza in Egypt, or the Colosseum in Rome, I expected this ancient looking, gigantic Buddha statue to have a fascinating history. Monks who came walking barefoot from all over Asia on a pilgrimage and then devoted the rest of their lives to building the statue.. something along those lines. But no such thing. Through the free WiFi on scene, I discovered that this ‘ancient’ beautiful Buddha is younger than I am. It was built between 1990 and 1993.

Get yourself along to here. We caught the train to the cable car. Easy. But find out how to jump the queue, we waited for 2 hrs for the cable car ride to the big buddha. Then caught local buses to the fishing village Tai Po (?) super easy. Found a boat going out to the dolphins (I swear I saw one but husband says only a wave), then a walk along the alleys and bought some crazy delicious giant squid pieces in a cup. And fresh honey between 2 crackers from a lovely old man. Everything fun except that queue.

Nice view along cable car ride. Cable ride might be closed during rainy days. That's what happen to us, when we reached Tung Chung MTR, announcement was made that the cable car was suspended due to rain. No choice we went to the Citygate outlet for shopping since we travel all the way from Kowloon. We managed to get some clothes and shoes. At around 11.30am cable car was resumed. The ride was very enjoyable, u can see the airport, waterfall, seaport. I guess u will be too busy looking out the window of the cable car rather than looking under ur feet (crystal cabin). No point to get expensive ticket for crystal cabin n just get the standard will do. It could be cold up to the village so be prepare with warm clothing.

Shoppers delight. Go via MTR using pass. Go very early as this is a popular place for locals especially on weekends. Village on both sides of city are local. Do not be daunted by long lines they do move quickly. Large discount shopping center
