There was a Hello Kitty theme in the village (not sure how it is related to the Big Buddha) so there were lots of opportunities for pictures with cute Hello Kitty statues!Instead of eating a sit down lunch at the monastery, we opted to buy a variety of snacks at the cafeteria style snack shop just 100m away from the main dining restaurant in the monastery. It was a great way to try different vegetarian options.We walked up all 249 steps to the Big Buddha. Again the view was spectacular!We spent about 3.5 hours there and when we left, the line up for the cable car to go to the village was extremely long. So glad we went early to avoid lengthy wait!

The best view in Hong Kong. What an amazing ride with an amazing view! The ride lasts for about 20 minutes and is well worth the effort. We caught the ferry to Lantau island, and the bus to the big Buddha, and the cable car back down, there were no queues at the top to get tickets or get on the cable car, however at the bottom there was a queue with a waiting time of 2 hours, glad we went the way we did!
Great place to visit. A long trill ride on cable car, nice set up and place for photo taking. The giant Buddha statues, the temple and the surrounding. It was worth every cents.

For the fitness enthusiast, walk Tung Chung to Tai O Village. We spent the day discovering the island. We first went up and down on the cableway, which was impressive from impressive buildings and construction to peaceful valleys and peaks. Then did the approximately 16 km hike from Tung Chung town center to Tai O Vilage via San Tau, Sha Lo Wan, San Shek Wan. A good path all the way, a few steep climbs but if you enjoy walking and are up for the challenge it will be worth the effort. Shady most of the way. Unfortunately the airport is close by and one can hear it at times but I still think it is worth the experience going through all these quaint villages and forest like setting.
Beautifull. What a lovely ride in the cable car to Lantau Island, the Village and Big Bhudda is great to see, lovely little shops all around to visit.

Wow. One of my biggest wish was to visit the greatest Budha in the world. To get there, I rode the gondola. We chose the one with the glass bottom. Lantau Island is beautiful. During the journey you can hear birds singing from the forest. Would definitely recommend, but be warned that around 17:00 access to Budha closes and the last bus leaves at 19:00.

Loved it . We spent a day visiting lantau island. We got the cable car up to ngong ping village. The weather was quiet bad so the view was not great but in general I'd say the view is spectacular. The big Buddha and the temple are lovely to see. We got a bus to Tai o to see the fishing village on stilts it is a real traditional little Chinese village was lovely to see. We did the boat trip around the village and out to see the white dolphins it lasted about 20mins. It is a lovely place to spend a day

Lantau Island to visit the Big Buddha. Finally managed to see the Big Buddha on Lantau Island.The unfortunate part this trip is the waiting queues but the MTR stop has good facilities for the tourist with numerous restaurants and cuisines.

Book ahead to avoid massive queues. We booked crystal cabin tickets to get to Ngong Ping village, and this saved us about 4 hours in queuing! We felt like royalty being told to walk past all the queues for people to buy tickets! Beautiful cable car ride past the airport, but be prepared for a very foggy skyline!

Worst day of my life!. Do not ever take this cable car trip on a weekend or holiday because you're gonna die of waiting in line (approximately 4 hours) even if u have advance online booking. We were with our 5 yr old son who got sick of the wait and the worst part is that they compelled us to get off once we reached the island despite our pleas that we'd rather not go down and look at the place so we can save another 2 hrs of waiting in line again for the cable car back! They should learn to inform people of such long lines and waiting time...well at least now you know.
View over the airport. From the cable car, I could see planes taking off and landing and it was so amazing. I had a clear sky but I am sure this one is worth at any weather.

Don't Overlook Lantau. So many people only pass through Lantau on the way from the airport to Kowloon or Hong Kong Island but they dont know what they are missing. Check out Disneyland, the Big Budha and Tai O.
Totally worth it!. Even though I´m not totally comfortable with heights this experience is totally worth it. The small village at the top is charming, even though it is very touristic.
The worst time spent in HK.. Just very dirty, nothing to do or see.We even got a beer mixed with water in a restaurant.Table was dirty, the worst service in my life.Again, very dirty place.

Nice place to visit. Avoid the queues by prebooking...cable car is great...big Buddha is interesting...many steps though...touristy shops and restaurants....the temple is the highlights d the fishing village is nice
A great day out from the city. There are great views of the airport from the cable car before you arrive at the Disney-like area before heading off for a spirtitial visit to the Buddha

A good one day trip. If you are with elders or kids, for your sanity, take the Ngong Ping Tour package esp. if you have not pre-booked. When we got here, the ticket counter line stretched to nearly 200 metres. You will waste your day and tire if you wait in line. Unfortunately it’s a “money talks” kind of scenario. You will be paying a premium to bypass all the inconveniences along the way. The package gets you the cable car ride, a bus trip and a short boat ride to the south china sea. The cable car ride is fantastic. The views are great and no amount of pictures can help you experience the journey to the Buddha statue. The bus trip is just to get to the village and is a timed affair which ends at the statue. The guide is the usual, corny English joke cracking character. You won’t remember anything he says but will remember his antics. The boat ride was good. Went through a housing colony set up on the banks in stilt houses which opened out to the sea. The boat had life jackets under the seats. But the speed boat is a tad small and fast moving so I found it a little uncomfortable without a life jacket on me. There are a few coupons that you get as part of the package which you can use in the restaurants and souvenir shops on the other side. Before you embark on the journey, please parcel some food for you and your gang. We packed a lot of rolls from Ebeneezers which turned out to be a life saver. There’s nothing decent to eat on the other side. Non-locals will find it difficult. There is a market where you can get decent quality souvenirs like magnets etc for cheap. I communicated (read bargained) with one such elderly shop owner using just numbers and got a good deal (I think).The Buddha statue is the grand draw and that is where most of the crowds head to. In HK this is a must do according to me.

Day Tour in Lantau Island- (Private Guide). Frank is an excellent guide , very professional. He provided us a nice car and driver and picked us at HK hotel. We visit the island, took the cable car , visit Great Budha and Temple. A lot of thing to do in Lantau in a sunny day.Frank is an expert in HK area, so is possible to arrange other tours with him. The driver, Ringo is very good. Good english spoken. Frank Law (Private Guide- frankhkexpert@yahoo.com.hk)
Beautiful Island. Must watch only once. Nice and quiet island, the monastery is nice, neat and clean and peaceful. the view from the cable car is breathtaking.

The best attraction in hong kong. This island is the best, the natural scenery is jaw dropping, and it has many walk paths for hikers and adventurers , and the heritage and culture are all so rich, with food varieties, I was happy to find a halal food restaurant there.

Very interesting island . Lantau Island has a lot going on. Visit the big Buddha, Tai o fishing village and enjoy a ride on the cable car. We booked a day tour and loved it. Would recommend when in Hongkong.

So much to do!. We only had two days to spend on Lantau and really wished we could have been there longer. Day one was spent at Hong Kong Disneyland which is simply magical and a must see for anyone travelling to the area.Day two we went to see the Big Buddha and the Wisdom Path. We took the bus up to the Buddha because it wasn't worth waiting in the insane queues for cable car tickets (and the bus is so much cheaper) and on the way we passed beautiful beaches we wish we had time to visit as well as many starting points to hiking trails that looked lovely. We walked about three-quarters up the Lantau Trail and then decided to come back because it was a bit misty but what we did see was really worth it and if we are ever there again we will make sure to explore the hiking trails of the island further.We barely scratched the surface of Lantau and would love to go back.

Fun ride, go early, skip the pre-booking!. We arrived early, about 0930, with our pre-paid vouchers. The line was not long at all at this time. It split into 2 queues--those with vouchers and those without. The without-voucher line moved MUCH quicker due to more windows committed to it, making us regret having prepaid. Despite this, we waited less than an hour before boarding, so not awful by any means. The glass-bottomed appeared to have no wait at all. Go early, get your tickets, and enjoy your morning! When we came back down around 1300, the line was painfully long--i don't think those near the end would actually get to see the buddha before the last cars down at 1800!
cable car ride- it was beautiful. well worth the wait (we stood inline for tickets for 90 minutes) but it was worth it. Wonderful views
Amazing place. A must visit area of Hong Kong. The giant Buddha is amazing. The view from the cable car is awesome.
tranquillity in HK. Get away from the crowds, go by MTR to Tung Chung then bus 11 to Cheung Sha beach! Excellent restaurants, try Stoep

Amazing Place. Lantau island is one of the must visit place when in HK. A big statue of Buddha is the main attraction point. Lots of people visit this place. There are two ways to reach there either by MTR or by Ferry. If one wants to enjoy sea route then take the ferry route and go to centralDiscovery bay pier, charges are around 25 hkd for adult one way afterwards take the bus which will take around 35 minutes to reach Lantau and in between you will enjoy the mountains area. The landscape is very very scenic. The other way is to go by MTR and drop at Tung Chung station and from there took a cable car ride which cost around 165 hkd.. or hire the bus cost around 22 hkd.Reaching is time taking in both the ways as it is one of the farthest from HK city but must visit. There is vegetarian restaurant in Lantau for eating. To reach near the statue one needs to step up around 220 stairs which is manageable as these stairs are designed in this fashion as one can take rest between them.

nice weather, nice view, nice on all your surroundings. the view is really make your jaw dropped at the cable car, if you dont affraid any high, please use crystal cabin, best at hongkong make sure you buy ticket online, because the queu very very long
Amazing- Top 5 attraction in HK. Must visit this beautiful island (which also houses the HK airport0 for its Giant Buddha status and one of the longer cableway rides in Asia.

Island for walking, heritage and culture and shopping. The island is worth at least a full day and more if you have it. From the outlet Mall at the MTR to the cable car to the Big Buddha Po Lin Monestery and walks to the coastal gem of TaiO. Travel there quickly by MTR and book the one way Cable Car online for the first and early ride up is worth it to experience it ahead of the crowds. After get a bus down to Tai O or to the Mui Wo ferry back to HK. Either way the bus ride a good way to see the island. I did both and got bus back to Tung Chung for the MTR back. All is possible because of the cheap, frequent buses so just pitch in its all doable in a day if you want.

Nice long ride to the Big Budda. It was a very nice scenic ride to the Big Buddha. It could feel bit long but there's lot for you to see during the ride. You almost feel like flying over the water and top of the mountain.
Nice Touristic place. Taking a boat ride from Hong Kong , this is a nice place and with many restaurant. You will find many seafood eateries all very nice

A great place to visit. There is lots to see and do if you are willing to walk. There are plenty of food stalls and sites to see. The cable car ride gives great views and is definitely worth the experience.

Amazing view of Hong kong. Lantau is the best place to visit in Hong kong specially during the cold season. The cable car ride gives a full view of Hong Kong metro including the airport. It is a very happy and peaceful place.

very much adventoures... although it was too much fun,but the height is so daring if u see down its like woooooooohh.we were all family in one cabin.and the place were it takes that place feels like u are in heaven,ders a huge statue of lord buddha.
Day trip. Lots to do and see if you are willing to walk. Plenty of food stalls and helpful people to assist. Take the ferry and make sure not to lose your tickets.

Buy your ticket early!!!!. Of any information you may receive on here, the #1 thing you must do is buy the ticket early. Failing to do so will put you in a 2+ hour line. I bought one-way glass bottom tix online and spent no more than 5 minutes waiting to depart the station.

Must visit place of interest. Lantau Island is a place of interest that you must visir if time allow. For travelers, you may transit yourself with MTR to Tung Chung Station. A few minutes walk to cable car station to Lantau Island. Weather is all round good. Do prepare an umbrella cause light shower may be expected in some months. Do go early so that you can explore Tai O together near to its Island.
Must visit by cable car. Must visit by cable car .. stunning views .. spend entire day .. visit Tai O fishing village and beach at Mui Mo if possible

Since you arrive here then spend time here. The airport is here some distance from HK island. Lantau is home to so much - airport, Disneyland, buddha, gondolas. Spend the whole day and cram as much as you can in.
peaceful place in HK. bored by the city life in HK (crowded), Lantau is a very good place to have a rest. people aren't stressed and there is a lot of activities to do (especially trails and Buddha)

The world's longest cable ride, a must do activity for HK visitors!!. An amazing cable ride to Lantau Island with breathtaking views of Hong Kong and the approaching Giant Buddha. The cable ride lasts around 25 minutes which I'm told is the longest cable ride in the world. That fact alone makes it worth going on. You can also choose between a normal bottom cable car and a glass bottomed one. I choose the latter and it was worth it!! It was also a lovely clear sunny day too and the clear blue sea and the reflections of the buildings and mountains onto it made it something spectacular to experience & see. It really filled up the senses! A must do activity for Hong Kong tourists!

The Chinese Village is a bit Kitsch but the Monastery is Beautiful. Worth visiting the island. The cable car is magnificent. You get a great view of the operations of the airport. The monastery gardens are peaceful and beautiful.The mock Chinese village is a bit to Kitsch. Not sure the Tang Dynasty had a McDonalds and Starbucks.The Buddha is impressive. Check out the date it was made.

Do not skip this amazing cable ride!. On a good day with some sun and not so cloudy you will have an amazing cable ride. Also the island is very beautiful with great views. You can not see the city but the landscapes are even as beautiful.

Very nice daytrip. If you want to escape from the hustle of HK then Lantau is the perfect place to go. The Island is beautiful and the bus ride only is already a treat! I can also recommend the village of tai-o were you get the chance to see the real Chinese life (if you get away from the Main Street and walk a bit further into town)

Thrilling Ride in Crystal Cabin. This was a birthday excursion for myself, my sister tagging along. We booked our tickets in advance (I would definitely recommend booking online previous) and arrived early without many lines. If you are able to go to the Big Buddha on the first trams out, and spend only a couple hours there, you are likely to get a cabin all by yourself on the ride back. Consider booking a regular cabin on your way out to the Big Buddha and a crystal cabin return, this will allow you (the chance) to have a private crystal cabin. You'll want pictures sitting on the floors, etc.. So it's better to have the crystal cabin to yourself! The grounds upon arrival are very clean and manicured. (Much more manicured and clean than the Great Wall-Badaling)

SIMPLY AMAZING!!. We went to see the Big Buddha and then climbed Lantau Peak (934m) and then took the cable cart back down from Big Buddha.Big Buddha was amazingly huge but the monastery area itself feels more private as it is an operating monastery. I enjoyed their architecture and the food offered there (all vegeterian which made me very happy) but otherwise i felt like i was invading something I should not go to but that is very personal feeling.The Peak was 934m, it was a hot day and sky was clear and we were breathless when we got up there, bring enough water! View was amazing. Did not want to leave.Cable Cart. Do not leave this part for after the sun set. Lines will be massive as everybody will be leaving. We took the Crystal Cart (Glass floor) purely to avoid nearly two hour long wait in normal cart line which after climbing the peak was worth it. It cost about 65HKD more per person than normal cart (115HKD vs 180HKD).

You can see the scenery under your feet. I rode crystal cabin cable car there. I was amazed by the scenery down. It was a safe ride and you won't regret purchase crystal cabin. I couldn't resist to take a picture of myself there. Next trip i surely will go there again.

Excellent Tourist Hot Spots. Lantau Island is the best tourist attraction in Hong Kong. The cable car, the big buddda, the disneyland, tung chung, tai O and the fashion outlet which you can spend at least two days there. The small fishing village in tai o that you can experience the old hong kong when it still a small fish village. The cable car and city gate can pair up for a one day visit. The transport is very convenience connected by MTR.

Over 1000 steps to the top of the Mountain.. (JK). I enjoyed my trip to the top of Lantau Mountain. It was high in the sky and a good use for my time in H.K. Go as early as possible even by 6, 7, or 8 a.m.

LANTAU ISLAND. My husband and I decided to make our way to Lantau Island on our own... We found Hong Kong's MRT amazing to use and made it to the stop we need to get too without a hitch. As you research about heading there especially to see the Big Buhhda keep in mind how busy these places get. Yes we thought we had left early enough for our day trip to Lantau, but we were caught up in the line up for over one and a half hours just to buy our tickets. On our return leaving around 2.30pm we went through the same situation. So all in all we loved the trip to Lantau, seeing the Buddha and spending time there amongst the quaint shops and having lunch but we would definitely suggest you pre purchase your tickets. You may still get caught in the crowds but for nowhere near as long. Immensely nice way to spend the day and no need to book a tour.
Hiking. The perfect place for hiking and awesome views if you aren't too afraid of wildlife. There are a few snakes and spiders a round. Especially around the infinity pool in tai-o

Tours by Locals: Escape to Lantau. Our private tour guide, Wouter van Marle, introduced us to the MTR, bus, ferry, and taxi (public transportation)! He met us at our hotel, then we took the MTR to catch the cable car to Ngong Ping. From there, we walked the plaza to see Big Buddha. Beware the 268 steps to Big Buddha! From there, we took a bus to Tai O fishing village, took a boat ride, saw the houses on stilts, and ate lunch on the patio of a local restaurant. Finally, we took a bus to the ferry, where we went back to Hong Kong, catching taxis to our drop-off point, our friends' hotel. This is a 9-hour tour including LOTS of walking - worth every step and cent!

The Big Buddha is the big draw.. but there are other things to check out.... Some tips: 1) Best way is to take the MTR (follow the maps to check which trains to change etc.) - MTR Hong Kong is among the best metro systems in the world (comparable to London and Berlin in terms of efficiency, if not size). It is cheap and relatively quick (yes, you can take a taxi which will save time but it will also cost more). 2) Once you get down at the last stop, walk out of the station, cross a couple of main streets and take a bus to Nong Pning.. note that, that bus stop is a little bit hard to figure out. You may see crowds everywhere and don't know where to wait for the bus. But, just follow the signs and you will get to where bus for Nong Pning stops - it is the second set of lines. Yes, especially over a weekend, there will be many people and the line itself will be long enough that you may have to wait for 2-3 buses to come and leave. But the wait is much shorter than you would wait, if you took the ropeway. 3) Over a Sunday, the bus fare is 27 HK Dollars. Note that you will need exact change (in case you don't have a prepaid ticket or an Octopus card - which you can use anbywhere in the train + bus system in HK). Else, they will make you pay for more and you will not get the change ack. On a another day of the week, the fare is 10 HKD cheaper (as of 2015 of course). 4) The ropeway is nice.. but it is too pricey (I think).. and the lines are 5 times longer than you would wait at the bus stop (especially over the weekend). It is better to take the bus up and the ropeway down (but then you might lose money - because, the round trip ropeway is only slightly more expensive (or even similar) than 2 one ways - one by bus and one by ropeway. 5) Once you get down from the bus - there is the really beautiful monastery to check out (with 1000 Buddha statues) and of course the Big Buddha upto which there are around 280 or so steps. (Some people say that there are 256 steps but I counted a few more!). 6) If possible, go as early in the morning as possible. That way, not only will you beat the crowds but you will also have the Sunlight ON the face of the Buddha and not the rear side. We were too delayed getting out of the hotel and so, by the time we reached, it was afternoon and did not get too many good photo opportunities with the really bright Sun belting down on the rear side of the largest standing Buddha in the world. Having said that, it is really peaceful up there and there are several great photo spots you will get - just not with Lord Buddha's countenance. 6) There are cute little traditional villages in Lantau. You can check those out if you are not pressed for time... Again, if you start your trip early, you can check out at least one of these hamlets and shop around, check out beaches etc. It is quite incredible that within 2 hours of travel time from one of the hubs of global commerce are these quaint little villages which, largely sustain themselves the same way as they have done for centuries. Worth checking out. What else.. well, if I remember something later, I will edit the same. But I hope these tips will help the traveler.

The Island with varied joy. The Island has the Tai O fishing village, Ngong Ping 360, the Po lin Monastery, the piazza, the airport and Disneyland!The cultural village and monastery are must see attractions. The cable car ride is good fun too. disneyland, needless to say is amazing.

A big yes . We booked a tour from the UK it included ferry travel to the island, a walk along the beach, up to the monastery, big Buddha and then lunch. We then went to the cable cars and then back to the HK Island. I would recommend this trip.

great taste of outer islands. A great way to spend the day away from the city and shopping! Lots of walks to do . Don't miss Tai O fishing village. Lots of atmosphere,good food. You can go by cable car and come back by ferry. Travelling around the island is really easy by local bus (get an octopus card) no need to buy tours and packages! Go in the morning and spend the day The best tip is to buy the cable car ticket ONLINE This can save you HOURS queuing for a ticket The lines are horrendous! The same goes for the tramway to Victoria Peak
Nice view. I love the cable ride. The queue to get inside the ride was quite long as it was a busy day but it was worth it. The view was really amazing. I will definitely be back again.

Big Buddha and some walking trails. Very nice way to spend a half day but watch for the stairs up to the Buddha. About 200 of them. Monks have a vegetarian restaurant worth trying. Can hike trail up to Big Buddha but long and tougher than just a trail

Great place!. This is one of the best places to visit in all of Hong Kong.The glass bottomed ropeway is definitely something to explore. The surrounding scenery looks beautiful on the way. Great experience overall!

Beautiful. Lan Tau Island is a must do trip on a holiday to HK. The cable car ride is just amazing as is the Buddha and the temples. The fishing village tour is great as well and we were lucky to see some dolphins. The overall feel of the village, you an sit back and have a nice cup of coffee. It is a nice and easy place.

It Has a Lot. Throughout Lantau Island, the beautiful scenery and famous historical sites were truly fascinating. There is a chain of mountains that stretches from the higher elevations in the west to the lower ridges in the east.

Greener and beautiful. Airport is located in lantau island. Hong Kong has three big islands. Lantau is biggest of them. Disneyland is too located here. Big Buddha and Ngong ping too. It is connected with beautiful bridge. This part is quite greener and less crowded.

Quick itinerary. We had limited time for our trip to Lantau. This is how we covered a fair bit of it in about 6 hours, H.K. Lantau H.K. Take the MTR to Tong Chong. We were not impressed with Tong Chong, so went directly to the bus terminal and then bus to Tai O. Back in time here but that is what we were after. Did a boat trip 1/2 hour to try and spot some Dolphins. No luck. If you want to see the dolphins I suggest you do not buy your ticket until you talk to customers getting off the boat on the trip before your trip. if they have not spotted dolphins, don't waste your time and money. You can spend an hour or so wander about Tai O, which we did. very clean toilets at the end of the main shopping lane...turn to the right and follow the signs. Then we took a bus to Mui Wo, which was also interesting and you could spend a day here but we did a quick look for about 1 hour. Then ferry from there back to H.K. If it is a hot day when you are travelling, then a swim at Silvermine Beach Mui Wo would be an option.

Give it a go!. The views from the car are amazing. If your not keen on heights this won't be for you! The cable car takes about 25 minutes to reach each side, completely worth it. Book your tickets online to save time and allow yourself an hour each side to queue for your car, it gets pretty busy.

Surprisingly good. My wife wanted to go, and while it didn't sound overly promising I went along. The Budda is def worth seeing. Others must agree as the tram line was almost an hour at 10am. Pay up for the "crystal" cabin with glass floor and the line is a bit shorter.
Away from Hustle Bustle City Life. This is away from hustle bustle city life. Calm and full of nature having some nice beaches, Pnong Ping village, Big Buddha. Scenic place and relaxing.
Beautiful view not worth the line up!!. Lined up for approx 1.5 hours before going across and another two hours in the freezing cold before heading back

Interesting sightseeing. Lantau Island must be visited for the Big Buddha statue, for the cable car Ngong Ping 360, for the temple Po Lin Monastery.Just be careful when you decide to go to the cable car as after 10 o'clock am it becomes very crowded, especially during week-ends. We stayed 3 hours at queue when going and 2 hours when returning. And the crystal cabin with transparent floor is a must.

Home of the Buddha . Haven't visited any of the villages or done the hiking trails but can highly recommend a visit to the giant Buddha via the nongping 360 cable car. Very worthwhile trip. Would love to do some hiking on the island during my next visit

Great Cable Car Ride. Great Cable car Ride but troublesome queues for the same waited almost for 3 hours for this one way and 2 hours on the way back standard cabin is ok but crystal cabin one way is a must have.

Prepare for long lines and amazing views. Ngong Ping 360 cable car runs a little over 3.5 miles, spanning from Tung Chung across the bay towards the airport and then onward to Lantau Island. The cable car gives you a panoramic view of the whole airport, harbor, and city before it travels through the surrounding mountains. The ride lasts about 25 minutes and takes you to Lantau Island. We were in queue for Ngong Ping 360 for a total of 3 hours on a Thursday afternoon. We had 2 choices - the standard cabin or the crystal cabin. The crystal cabin in a bit more expensive but still we went with that option. A little bit scary at first but the glass bottom allows a 360 degree view experience. I am little afraid of heights, but I would still recommend. Lantau Island is an amazing place where you can stay up to 5 hours. Climb the stairs to see the Buddha closer and take some photos of it. This is one of the 5 largest Buddha statues in China called Tian Tan Buddha which is impressively 34 m tall, weights 250 tons and it’s made of bronze. Keep in mind, the Big Buddha is 268 stairs up!We had a great time but were worn out afterwards. We experienced a 90 minute wait to get back on the cable car back home. To avoid long waits, try purchasing your tickets ahead of time. We saw many people bypassing the lines because the already had vouchers. Cheers!
Great place. I always like visiting Lantau and going to Tung Chung and exploring CityGate. The outlets stores are pretty good.

Easy to escape the tourist traps. The que for the cable car was 2hrs, as on a cloudy Friday in November I hadn't expected it to be so busy. Advance purchase of tickets may have saved me on hour, so I would recommend it. The cable car ride was worth the wait, with amazing views. Once there don't miss out on the 100budda main temple. From there I highly recommended escaping the crowds and hopping on a bus to Tai O. Buses are cheap, take Oyster cards and leave regularly. Tai O is a beautiful fishing village with great walks.

Avoid weekends and get there early- Long lines for the cable car. Avoid weekends and get there early- Long lines for the cable carTake the MTR to Lantau Island and then the cable car . You can chose the glass bottomed one if you are not afraid of height- more expensive. There are a lot of step leading to the big Buddha. This is a must do in Hong Kong.

Giant Buddha & Cable Car. This was the best part of our visit to Hong Kong. Spectacular views are to be had over the area, and the cable car ride is a must. The Temple is amazing along with the Bell which the Shaolin monks donated to it. All food outlets are Vegetarian, lots of gift shops located around the sight with all funds going to the Temple charity. Did not see one monk on our visit? We visited as part of a tour organised by Lantau tours limited.

Up up and away... Better go by bus!. Totally overrated ride with the very expensive cablecar, long cueing and high price, especially for the (totally useless!) cristal cab, there is absolute nothing of interest to be seen under the cab! You see everything better through the windows.We had to wait for 90! minutes cramped in tourists. Only the first and the last minutes of the ride are interesting.Going by bus is much cheaper AND! much more beautiful! On Top is worth the visit, interesting! Walk a lot, you wont regret!The island itself is very beautiful and interesting, many things to explore!Just my piece of cake.

The Island you must have seen. It is so nice to take the Metro to the cablecar. Fantastic ride with the longest cablecar in the world, spectaculair. Vistit here the great, big Buddha, the monestery. After take the bus to the fischermansvillage.

Worth a visit. It is the largest island in HK. Major attractions are - Buddhist architecture; fireworks over Sleeping Beauty's castle; a long sandy beach; a mall of shopping outlets. You must visit the Big buddha, Po Lin monastery and take a cable car ride to Ngong Ping 360.

A suprising Island to visit. I actually stayed on this Island during my most recent visit to Hong Kong. I took advantage of being close to the Airport and the cable car to Big Buddha and a few other near by attractions (see other reviews).I enjoyed being close and would plan to include this on one end of a future trip. I came in late in the evening so it made the commute to my hotel a snap, then toured the Big Buddha area the next day while on the Island as well. Disney land HK is here also as are some smaller sleepy villages listed in every tour book

Viator Lantau Island Day Tour was excellent and a MUST DO!. They pick you up at your hotel, took the ferry across to Lantau and boarded a bus through a scenic drive to Pui O Beach. After this we drove to Tai O Fishing Village, loved walking through open street Markets and seeing Kwan Tai Temple from 1488 followed by a small sampan boat seeing the stilt houses. Drove to the Big Buddha and to Po Lin Monastery Vegetarian Restaurant for a "just ok" Lunch. Walked through Ngong Ping Village (very Disney-esque) to the Ngong Ping 360 Skyrail Cable Car...amazing views.

Book a glass cabin in advance to save time from long queue. So glad that I booked it on its website in advance. I arrived at 9.30 am. There were like a hundred people queueing to purchase a ticket already. I printed the ticket which had a barcode so I could go directly to the cabin line. The normal cabin line had like at least 70 people. But for glass cabin, there were like 15 people. If you want to save time, please book and print the ticket from home.

Interesting and worthwhile. Well worth taking an officail tour on spending the day. From the ferry port to the village of Tai O there a r e views to be had. The walk through th village is of interest and shows a way of life for the people in the stilt houses. You are then off to thee big budha and this is one you want to see. The monestry then supplies a free vegetarian lunch, which was lovely and very filling. Then the cable car ride back to the mainland, now this will blow your mind, all in all a great day wss had by all.

Amazing Day Trip out of Hong Kong Central. Really enjoyed the green space and fishing village of Tai O about 45 minutes out of Kowloon. I took a tour which included the cable car, monistery, Buddha statue and a great boat ride to appreciate Tai O village which is built largely on stilts, and the white Dolphins. Overall a fantastic day. Make sure to enter the shrine inside the Buddha to see the relics.
Beautiful island with many trails and fisher villages. Take your time to discover Lantau. There are so many hidden trails, temples and places worth visiting.

Full Day. We arrived on Lantau Island by 9:30am on Tuesday and there was already 75 minutes to get on the cable car.( Suggest you buy your tickets on line ( look for discount tickets on discover Hong Kong website)for the crystal cable car because this will allow you bypass the line up and crystal cable car line is much shorter and it is worth the extra $50HK /person. The cable car ride is 25 minutes and the views are magnificent. The Budda is site not be missed once you reach the top after climbing the 305 steps.There is also Po Lin Monastery .

Tung O Ancient Trail. This is a heritage hike from Tung Chung to Tai O, stretching over 16 km. This route was once an important passage for villagers to commute between Tung Chung and Tai O. A good part of this trail follows the coast, passes mangroves and bays, and ends at the quaint fishing village of Tai O. We read about this trail from 'Your Guide to Hiking & Cycling in Hong Kong', a HK Tourism Board publication. Make sure you get a copy before leaving the airport.To begin your hike, take the MTR to Tung Chung Station. Get out at Exit B, walk for a couple of minutes to Tung Chung Fire Station. Walk down Yu Tung Road passing Yat Tung Estate, and at near the end, turn right and follow the signage to Hau Wong Temple. We had to ask a passerby for direction because it wasn't clear which way we should walk from the fire station. There are toilet facilities along the route, and even replenishing stations for us to catch our breath. We enjoyed the bean curd sold at one of the stalls. Even with the availability of food and drinks, remember to stock up on water because it is a long route.Although this hike is classified as 'Fairly Easy' in the guide booklet, do not be deceived. Some slopes are rather steep. In fact, we found this hike more challenging than the 'Moderately Difficult' Dragon's Back trail, partly because the Tung O trail is a lot longer. A hiking stick would help.Continue walking and you would end up at Tai O fishing village, Spend some time roaming the alleys of this village. Try the local snacks and even partake in a seafood meal. Prices are not cheap though.Once you have had enough of Tai O, you can take Bus 11 from the bus terminus back to the MTR Tung Chung Station. Alternatively, you could do like what we did - head for Mui Wo on Bus 1. Mui Wo was Lantau's largest settlement before Tung Chung was born.Expect to spend about 5 hours for the trail.

Really Easy To Get There on The Cable Car. Years ago - it took a rickety bus journey but steep winding hills to get to Lantau but things have changed. A super efficient cable car takes you over the water and gives excellent views of the airport and vastly reduces the travel time. Win Win.Lantau is luscious and green and just a short hop; from Hong Kong island, it's definitely worth the trip, and gives you another perspective of the Hong Kong area.
If you have time whilest on the way to the airport. A nice stop before you get to the airport. Only if you have your bags already checked from HK.See the Buddah!

Beautiful. Take the scenic Cable Car and soak in the beautiful sights. But be prepared to wait in long queues for the Cable Car. It may stretch upto anywhere between 2 to 3 hours. Cable Car available are standard and a 90 HKD dearer Crystal (glass bottom) cable car

FOUR HOUR WAIT FOR GONDOLA RIDE. The actual gondola ride is wonderful...HOWEVER...after 10am on weekends you will have to wait FOUR HOURS to actually get on the gondolas. The attractions near the Big Buddha close at 6:30pm. Therefore, you will NOT have time to relax and enjoy the lovely tourist village on top of the mountain. The ticketing company puts out signs saying "75 Minute Wait"...this is A BLATANT DECEPTION...from the queue starting point down on the road, it takes over TWO HOURS just to get to the ticketing office. From there you have to join another queue to wait another TWO HOURS to then board a gondola. Just like a Disney theme park...they entice you to keep waiting because you turn many corners and cannot see all of the queue in front of you!!!If you live in Hong Kong...no problem...you can always return. However...if you are a tourist, then it means that you will spend most of your day waiting in a queue for a 15 minute gondola ride. CRAZY CRAZY CRAZY. Then...getting OFF the mountain is almost as bad...!!! There is another TWO HOUR queue to return on a gondola to Tung Chung. OR...you can line up for a bus....the buses are good and come every 15-20 minutes, but there is no sign explaining this to the public, so people have no idea how long they have to queue and get very anxious and frustrated. If there are 200-300 people in the queue, then you have to wait a long time to actually get on a bus...!!!SUGGESTION - GO EARLY. DO NOT QUEUE AFTER 10am ON WEEKENDS!!!
Big Buddah island. Lantau Island is easily reached on the metro . A short connection bus ride will take you to the famous big Buddah
Simply Beautiful. A must do for all, great for every traveler. The cable car is a fantastic way to see the view and relax.

Mui Wo, Ngong Ping and Tai O in a day. Lantau Island mainly consists of 3 areas of attraction - Mui Wo (mainly a beach, a trail, a small waterfall, a 4m wide cave), Ngong Ping (where the Po Lin monastery, Tian Tan Buddha, Wisdom path, Lantau trail are), and Tai O fishing Village. If you hope to do all of these in a day, you should set off early. I took the 8+am ferry from Central Pier to Mui wo, and spent a few hours chilling at the beach. I then headed for the waterfall which was underwhelming, but you can get onto the rocks and take a nice photo. I would strongly recommend renting a bicycle for Mui Wo, the roads are flat and you would get around so much faster instead of walking 30mins to get from the beach to the falls. I then took a bus to Ngong Ping (Po Lin monastery says the sign at the bus terminal) which was maybe 40minutes? Headed to Po Lin monastery for a quick look and a meal. Do try the beancurd dessert there. Although I went on a Tuesday, the Buddha area was rather packed with tourists. I didn't go up stairs to the Buddha, and then headed to the Wisdom Path. I absolutely enjoyed the walk and it's very peaceful. There is a small dirt path upslope at the Wisdom Path where it's a lookout spot to see the Buddha's back view. Afterwhich, I walked through to Ngong Ping village for the bus to Tai O. It leaves frequently even on weekdays. Tai O is a fishing village crucial to HK and it is still a famous area for villagers. It is famous for its stilt houses, seafood, egglets (similar to waffles) made with charcoal grill instead of gas, prawn paste, the old police station turned heritage hotel, and dolphin watching tours (25 minutes for 20HKD).Although I didn't get to see dolphins during the Nov period, I have friends who have seen the Chinese dolphins on the boat tours in May. There is a straight bus from Tai O to Tung Chung bus terminal (MTR station). However, if you are leaving at 5pm onwards, the queue for the bus can be long. You are likely to miss a few buses (freq 10-20mins for peak). However, I would recommend you stay a little later because the street market comes alive in the evening and even watch the sunset on the island/boat ride)

Do the Lantau Peak hike if you can!. We took the Po Lin Monastery -> Pak Gong Au direction (most websites suggest going the reverse) - steep climb up to the peak but the views were definitely worth it. We took about 1.5 hrs pacing ourselves. Cloudy on the Buddha side, but sunny on the other! Bring sufficient water as it is humid and especially if you go this steep section uphill. Seemed like most do the longer but gentler ascent up the other way, but I'd imagine the steep descent would be heavy on the knees.

Lovely island!. Wow! This is a beautiful island and a great place to fly into. The views of the mountains and over the water are just stunning. Definitely worth coming to the island, but maybe not the cable cars to the Big Buddha unless you have literally your entire day to spend here.

You have to do this. Take the MTR to Lantau Island and then the cable car (pref glass bottomed) up to see the big Buddah. Apart from the cable car queue to buy tickets, this is a must do in Hong Kong.
Most beautiful and peaceful area in Hong Kong. Easily accessible, it's green and peaceful, with beautiful mountains and beachs with nice lounges, and restaurants.

Lantau island. We wanted a day away from the hassle and bustle of Hong Kong but were a bit disappointed by Lantau island. There weren't many places to eat that weren't quite expensive for very basic food and there wasn,t a lt to see. The beach was a disappointment and the market small and just people yelling at us to eat at their restaurant.

A different view of Hong Kong !. Visited Big Buddha by Cable Car. It the largest sitting Buddha in the world at Lantau Island. Views from Cable car are stunning. The place was suggested by a friend as the view from top is of a different Hong Kong i.e. natural surroundings !
Gorgeous!. This island is so spectacular! We so enjoyed viewing it from the cable car and our time by the buddha!
its best place for peace lover !. its top view made me crazy and has great peace and great reflection of best place of honkong. must visit place.

Great Experience. We took an afternoon trip to Lantau Island, so glad we did!Firstly we rode on the long cable car to access the island....this was a novel form of transport and provided fantastic views.Then we went to visit the Giant Buddha. A very interesting and spiritual place, well worth a visit.Our final stop was the old fishing village built on stilts. This was amazing, though we were sad to learn from our guide that due to overfishing the fish we saw for sale had not been sourced locally but imported, as local waters can no longer sustain the local demand!

Great experience to see a Big Buddha in the hill of the Island.. To see a Big Buddha statue int he hill of the island and riding cable car for 20 minute to reach the place, was really excited. We also visited the fishing village and took a cruise for 15 minutes to see around the village. It was worth to try.

Great day out. Don't line up!Grab a day trip ticket from the Cable car ticket office that includes return trip on cable car, a return bus trip to the fishing village and a guided tour of the Big Buddha and Monastery. It's great value for money.Our trip to the fishing village included a boat trip out into the harbour where we saw pink dolphins. I'd suggest you pay a little extra and get one of the crystal cabins. Going over the bay is a glass floored cable car is something special. The cable car trip takes about 25 minutes each way.Vegetarian lunch at the Monastery is also not to be missed.
Great nature. The big buddha and a fishing village are located on this island. It's a very nice place to visit. It has great nature and the big buddha and the village are well worth visiting.
A must do. Enjoyed the 360 cable car ride up and back to the Big Buddha. Fortunately, as a tour party we jumped the queues which seems to be ridiculously long. If I had to queue, I wouldn't.
Worth a try. The amazzing Island that is accesible by MTR and the one can take the crystal cable car ride to an fro. Old and young all can have a great experience with awesome view.

Long Q. Easy to get too by train and then the Cable car ride to the top is great But we had to Q for over 2 hours to catch the cable car and it was a cold day so no fun standing in line for that amount of time. The cable car ride is nearly 30 minutes long with great views

Buy your ticket online to skip the long queue!. We went there at 10am+ and luckily we bought the ticket in advance (via klook) and able to skip the long queue & directly get our tickets at the pre-booked counter. However, we still need to queue for approx 30 mins to board the cable car even we got our tickets. Terrible waiting lines and I can't imagine how long do I need to wait if i didn't bought the ticket in advance!Long cable car trip, it's scary but nice view. Overall, A great half day trip for me!Tips: to avoid the long queue, kindly buy your ticket in advance. I bought mine at Klook website. The price is even cheaper than the official website.

Excellent!. Lantau Island was a great place to visit in Hong Kong. The cable car and the Big Buddha at Lantau Island was so amazing. It was a wonderful experience it was really a great place for traveler.
good tram ride. Tram ride to Lantau Island was very thrilling to . we took the crystal cabin with glass floor . its almost 30 -45 mins ride .

Impressive cable car ride.. Take the MTR orange line to the end and get on the cable car to the top of Lantau Island. To avoid long queues (over one hour) be sure to book your tickets prior to your visit through an agent.

great. Did a day tour of the island and it was wonderful. Tour guide gave some interesting facts about island. One I liked best was there is only 50 taxi's on island. Lunch was had at Monastery and was very nice. Great trip back on the cable car, lasted round 30 mins.

A place away from the hustle and bustle of HK. This is an island connected to HK and site of the international airport. One of the most enjoyable way to reach Lantau Island would be to take the subway to Tung Chung station, and change to the cable car at Ngong Ping 360. Highly recommended to purchase the tickets online prior to your visit since it would mean bypassing the queues to buy the cable car tickets. One of the key attractions on this island is the temple and the huge statue. You can have a vegetarian meal there too for a unique experience. Other places on the island worth a visit would be Tai-O and Mui Wo for a throwback to the fishing villages of HK in the early days.

A variety of transports to and from this beautiful island. We travelled to Lanrau by ferry, took the bus to a Ngong Ping. Gorgeous place with the giant Buddha looking over everyone. Well worth the visit. Fury little shops in the village and then a fantastic ride to the outlet shopping centre on the cable car, not brave enough to do the crystal bottom one tho! Then took the MTR back to HK Island!

Hiking trails. I have lived on Lantau island for 16yrs and only recently started hiking its many hiking trails. There are many trails to choose at different levels of difficulty and time . My favourites are Tung Chung to Tai O , Tung Chung to Mui Wo and Pui O to Mui Wo . I suggest buying The Hiking Trails of Hong Kong Books to get more info.There are fantastic views, lush vegetation , waterfalls , cascading streams, old Villages,The odd water buffalo, birds etc . All hiking trails are well posted.

A different view of HK. The usual Victoria Peak view is different here. From here, you can experience nature and keep all of the urban views away. Strong winds is expected here and sometimes, it could be misty. It is quite a nice experience to visit here and spend half a day to walk around. If you have time, why not do some hiking?

Getaway Trip with friends. Joined the trip under Cathay Pacific Supercity Package with 3 lovely friends. Enjoyed the food so much in Hong Kong in particular, Dim Sum and also the famous roasted goose. We had a fantastic evening at Lan Kwai Fong, a place one should not miss if you happened to be in Hong Kong. It was extremely crowded that night because of Halloween night. The half day city tour that covers the Peak and cruising the harbour where the Jumbo Floating Restaurant is located reminded me of my first time visit to Hong Kong about 30 years ago. Another place one should not miss to visit is to Lantau Island to see the big Buddha and also to the fishing village in Tai O for nice seafood. You can travel there by Cable car or by bus. I choose to travel by bus.

Great see something beside shops and high rise. Easy to get do. Book cable car ride online and beat Qs. Shops same as....take time to visit fishing village and $25hk 20 min boat trip. Don't expect to see pink dolphins

Good place in HK. Views from the Cable car is good and the view of the city even more enchanting. A small village out there on top has many shops that sells souvenirs and many such take aways. MTRs would help you to get to the bottom of this place easily and then you can take the cable car or take a hike. I would suggest to take the cable car

Fun day trip. We spent the morning and early afternoon at the Tian Tan buddha and Ngong Ping village, then took a taxi down to Cheung Sha beach. Easy to get to on the Tung Chung line. We were surprised to learn that the taxis are not all the same. Red taxis are only for travel back to Kowloon/HK Island. Blue taxis are for trips on Lantau iteslf. TMYK.
A must see in Hk. Would strongly recommend anyone visiting hong kong to go here. views from the cable car to the top are just breath taking.

Big Budda and Po Lin Monestary. We caught the train from MTR Olympic Station Kowloon side to Tung Chung station. You end at the CityGate shopping outlets. These are worth a visit before or after you ride the cable car. Walk to the Ngong Ping 360 Cable Car station. This was about 10.00am at this stage and the ques were long we waited an hour all up before we got into a cable car. We caught the normal standard car not the glass floor and the views were breathtaking. It rides very high, but is nice and slow and steady. It goes a long way 5.7 klms ride. You stop at the little village with plenty of little restaurants quiet a good variety of western and asian food. Some gift shops and good amenities. We walked our way onto the Big Buddha and climbed up all the steps. There was plenty of resting platforms. We then made our way to the Po lin Monastery with its rich gold buddhas and amazing architecture and beautiful ceilings etc. There is a vegetarian restaurant just beside the monastery run by the monks should you wish to try it.We missed the Wisdom Path.From here we made our way back to the village area and there is a Local Bus Station.We made our way to Toi O Fishing Village where the houses are sitting on stilts in water.There you can take a little boat ride byone of the locals. Theres also the little Toi O village of little shops selling their dried food goods etc. You get more of the real Chinese fishing village custom here. We caught the bus back to the Ngong Ping Village where the big buddha is. And from there we rode the Cable Car back to Tung Chung. This trip was well worth it today.

Nice place to hang out .... The exciting ways one can reach are by cable car or run/hike.There is a small village, where there are several souvenir shops, places to eat.This is where the Po Lin Monastery is. It also has the big Buddha statue.My wife and I liked the trip. it took us the whole day - while we were lucky that we did not have to stand in the long serpentine queue for the cable car [managed my our tour operator]Please do not miss the vegetarian lunch at the restaurant inside the monastery.
Went to see the Big Buddha. The Buddha was cool, but the highlight was the tram ride. I took the least expensive car. If you take pricier glass bottom car, an added bonus is the wait is much shorter.

cable car ride , excellent, Big Buddha , impressive. the cable car ride is excellent, especially if you take the car with the glass bottom, its a little more expensive but its worth, the ride is over mountain, a river so you get a clear view below and all 4 sides, exciting ride.The Big Buddha statue was huge and impressive. a pure vegetarian restaurant is there next to the temple of 1000 buddha statues.
Ok, wouldn't return. Odd little place. Hiked around to the next ferry dock. First beach has view of the coal plant, next town had great seafood fare. Swimming ok. Just an average experience.

Beautiful island of Hong Kong. My friend Irene Ho brought me in this island 10 years ago and she brought me back again there when I visited Hong Kong from Canada.I'm always in love with this great water and island. It's a must to visit Hong Kong with the tourist spots.

The Perfect Anti-dote to Hong Kong and Kowloon Cities. Country Parks and rural fishing villages dominate. It is also home to the International Air Port, Disneyland and new high-rise developments to the north of the island. But it is well worth a visit and here's an idea for a day trip to Lantau.1. Take the MTR Tung Shun Line all the way to Tung Shun.2. Take the cable car to Ngong Ping for the Po Ling Monastary and Big Buddha (both reviewed separately)3. Take the Bus (hourly) to Tai O village.4. Take an inexpensive boat trip to see the wooden-stilt houses along the waterfront and, on a good day, the pink dolphins out in the bay.5. Wander through the village with its market and tiny shops and along the shore line to the Old Police Station perched on the cliff-side.6. Tea and cheesecake would be my recommendation at the Old Police Station, but a wide range of refreshments are available.7. Walk back to the village and take the bus back to Tung Shun and the MTR back to Hong Kong City for a bit of night life.Tip: It's far cheaper to do this trip for yourself than pay the HK$830 for a guided tour, and with a good guide book, you will miss nothing.
Close to HK but plenty to see and do. The cable car to the summit, the Big Buddha, the temple, the restaurant, the fishing village on stilts - well worth a day trip from Hong Kong

One of our highlights . We took the MTR to Tung Chung and is then just a short walk to the cable car. The sign said 75 min wait to get to the ticket desk and they weren't wrong!! We then had to queue again to bet on a cable car. We went on a Sunday and hadn't pre booked tickets. My advice...pre book if you can. Despite the long wait it was great, view from the cable car was amazing and worth the wait. We didn't go in the glass bottomed cable car, not sure it is worth it as there is more to the view than just looking down.

A great day trip. Easy to get to using the MTR, just take the Tung Chung line to Tung Chung (the terminus). Take the ropeway up to the big buddha and the monastery. There's also an outlet mall at Tung Chung.
Green side of Hong Kong. Eventough the airport built in there, Lantau is still the green side of Hong Kong.. Disneyland, Big Buddha, Ngong Ping,

Nice place, beware of the weather. Easily reachable from the Aiport, just hop on to a bus and a few stops away.It was almost cloudy when we reached. And it rained all the way during the cable car ride. A good view of airport is all that we got. Rest was a ride in the cloud. Though enjoyable, a sunny day would have been much fun.Make sure to read the weather forecast before you reach here. Better to head here in case you are reaching by early morning flight and you checkin after 2pm. You can save on time and reaching here from HK island takes lot of time.

Unbelievable scenery from the Cable Car ~ Big Buddha. We visited here as part of a tour. Longest cable car 6.7 km and about 25 minutes. Crystal carriages have glass floors. Spectacular views over the airport. Travel over water and land rising 472 meters

The best day tour we did. We took a day tour which included the was village, the giant buda and the cable car ride. The buda was HUGE and the cable car 5.3klm the longest I have ever seam, and it was continuous.

it's OK experience.. took glass bottom cable car when leaving the Buddha back to the city, the line up is much less; since the ticket is more expensive, but you can see more. I've took better cable car ride of more interesting place, therefore........

Standard or Crystal Cabin, go for it!. I really didnt see much diference rather than the price, so I got the standard cabin. If You had to choose, try to go when its a beautiful day otherwise you wont be able to see much. Amazing how some people actually do some hiking along the way....

Oasis in the busy city. The Lantau island should be a must visit on the itinerary. It is recommended to take the cable car one way (preferably while going up) and perhaps a bus while coming down, to enjoy the trip to its fullest.
a different experience. the Island of Lantau has many faces, with many modern buildings on one hand, and a bit of culture and tradition on the other hand, which is nice

Could have been in Switzerland – but we weren’t. This was a really good experience and one I am pleased we did. Caught the train to the end of the line and then queued for 20 minutes to get a glass bottomed cable car – parting with 155 HKD per person.Great views beneath our feet and also out of the windows across the bay to the airport and beyond.Thirty minutes we arrived at the top, near the Big Buddha having had a good trip. Yep, value for money.
Best part of Hong Kong. Beautiful little village, Po Lin Monastery, and Bog Buddha are all worth the trip alone. Definitely take the Ngong Ping 360 air tram for breathtaking views on your way.

Charmingly different atmosphere from the highrises. I was charmed by the bedroom districts of Lantau. It is worth the bus ride to see the far flung ports of TAi O and Mui Wo. Although Tai O gets it's share of tourists, it is still, at bottom, a place where people live. And many of them live in little hovels on stilts overlooking muddy tidal flats. Interesting. You can feel the slower pace here.I also took a bus to Mui Wo and then a ferry to Peng Chau. Peng Chau was very small and quiet. It is hard to believe a place so tranquil exists within a 45 minute ferry ride from downtown skyscrapers.
What a ride on cable car. Visit is must for people who want to be in lap of nature. Serene views...picturesque land scape n extraordinary feeling with the monk
Lantau Island by Cable Car. It is a 25 minutes ride by cable car. Get an awesome view of both the harbour and the airport. Coming back was by tourist bus.

Most of the Tourist Attractions are on this Island. Ngong Ping Cable car to Big Buddha, Hong Kong International Airport, Disneyland and other attractions are all in the Lantau Island.To be included in your Hong Kong Tour itinerary.
Something different. Good place to visit, I think most people over look it. Now that Uber is in H-K, much easier to get to and get around. The last tram is 5:30 pm.

Friendlier and More Enjoyable than Hong Kong by Far!. Worth the Visit and Ride of your life, views fun. Get the right persons in your Group in this contraption otherwise its a long difficult journey...

Great views of Lantau from the cable car. Great views from the cable car the island looks beautiful with a few hotels doted around you can also see the airport, the MTR goes there too and is the end of the line.

this place is really the best place in hong kong. whenever you are ready to visit hong kong,you must try visiting this island or you would miss 1 of the best chance during your residence in hong kong , its really cool island & there are many transports to use when you visit it but i recommend you to use cable car if you really wanna enjoy your journey to go there ,you cant resist the nature beauty while you are on the way ,its sure you will keep recording video & take much photos & selfies with that cool place,its where big buddha exist too & the nature there is really cool,you must visit it .

awesom & long track cable car. This attraction is soooo amazing. We can enjoy the beautiful nature view of lantau. No skyscrapper at all. The island is beautiful. We can enjoy it from the cable car. And another good thing is the track of cable car is very long. So we can really enjoy the view

Not so much hustle and bustle.. If you love the shoulder to shoulder business and being right in amongst everything maybe stay in Kowloon or on Hong Kong Island. Lantau not quite as crazy busy and we stayed at Novatel Citygate only a 5min free shuttle from the airport. MTR 5 mins walk for access to Hong Kong CBD about 30 to 40 mins on train. Large Citygate outlet shopping for name brand stores. 5mins walk to Pnong Ping cable car up to the Big Bhuda, plus some other things you can do including Disney World for the kids. For the cheaper market shopping MTR or bus into Kowloon to Nathan Rd and all the various cheaper market shopping, it is crazy busy though in the markets but a great experince.

Beautiful and serene. The best way to get here is by ferry, and then return via the gondola. Great day trip from Hong Kong to see a more remote and green part of the city, along with an incredible monastery. Another must do.

Very good, be sure to buy tickets online to save time. My 2nd trip up to see the monastery, on a nice this is a nice trip. Depending on how long you are in Hong Kong, time to the city attraction due to the time it takes (easy 1/2-3/4 day). You can take the cable car up and bus down to save 50 HKD/pp, but it does take a bit longer. The view from the cable car is great and it provides a nice ride, I would not recommend the upgraded crystal 360 package, as you are really only getting a glass bottomed floor. Make sure to buy your ticket online, as you will skip most of the lineup and there is no price difference.

Life on Lantau. Lantau is full of greenery, it's a really nice place to visit for a holiday and full of places to hike have fun or even just to relax. My personal favourite place to go in Hong Kong is Disney Land, I'm only twelve. Definitely recommended for people with children or if you want a nice holiday with someone.
Peace and calm . A one of its kind place and a must visit place in Hong Kong the majestic statues are just waiting for u to come and pay obedience or just simply enjoy the view of them.

A great day trip. I had a day to explore the island before my flight home. It was easy to get around. I had pre-booked the cable car which saved me a LOT of time in line - please do this. (I chose the more expensive glass bottom one, I thought it was worth it.) After exploring the big buddha, I took a bus to one of the small towns. It was great to walk around, eating at a casual place, seeing all the dried fish, and stilt houses. It was a great break from the hustle of Hong Kong.

Amazing. Take your time, and enjoy all the different aspects of the park. If you have the energy (and plenty of water) walk up the 268 steps to Big Buddha, pay the $38hk to go inside the Buddha, and read how they transported him and built him, the price includes an ice cream and water

One day visit. Make sure to put Lantau Island on your intermarry once in HK. The island can be reached by MTR from Kowloon or HK island. there are plenty of cafe's, restaurants and shops. There is also the Big Buddha, Po Lin Monastery and other attractions to keep you busy for the entire day. Beware - the last bus and cable car back to the MTR station is at 18:30.
Amazing. distinct and beautiful. loved the trip up, was a amazing cultural day, would recommend to anyone interested
Worth a visit. Those who have knee problem please don't come here because have to climb up the stairs for at least 45 minutes.can be compatible with those in China.

Lots of activities for a day trip !. Came on a layover from the airport, and I was able to do so much !I even made a quick video guide, giving info about the logistic, pricing etc on a layover, check it out on my profile !

Worth a visit for the first time. We went on a Monday and queue at cable car was as Long as 45mins wait. Ride took about half hour. If u r hungry, there r shops along the way to fill stomach. The climb up to see the Buddha was a peaceful experience but tiring. All a good experience.

Book online to avoid Queues. We went there in a Sunday and gas to spent 2 hours going and hour and plus coming down.Once you reach there it is an experience and the sight of giant Buddha is peaceful.Must to do once there in HK

Great day out. A twenty minute train ride from Hong Kong Station will bring you to Tung Chung. From there take Exit B at and head to the far left hand corner of the square for the cable car terminal to the island itself. The cable car journey lasts around twenty minutes, standard car costs 165 HK Dollars. I booked it online a week or so in advance and printed off my ticket at home. The queue for tickets at 09:30 hours today was already around 30-40 people and it was good to avoid this (at 13:00 hours it must have been in excess of 200). I obviously went to the Big Budda once on the island, but one of the quieter places was the 'wisdom trail' the start of which is only a ten minute walk from it and the views are spectacular.

Lantau Island - Giant Buddha and cable car. The giant Buddha is well worth visiting. Travel is easy using the train to Tung Chung Station and then cable car. The last part of the trip by cable car takes nearly half an hour and offers amazing views. The village where the cable car ends, Ngong Ping Village, is very touristy and theme park like, but once you get through that the Buddha and the Wisdom Walk are well worth visiting. There are bush walks / hikes through the forest too.

Great escape from main city. Hong Kong Island is wonderful, but a nice little escape out of the city to this island is a great idea. Lots to do and to see, lots of different ways to get to the island as well. We took a ferry and then a bus up to Big Buddha, went to the other sites in the area and then took the cable cars down to head on home. Great way to explore another part of Hong Kong, highly recommend.

A place to go hiking. There is the Big Buddha in this island, easy to get there and great chance to have fun with family and friends. But also you can plan to go hiking in this island, plenty of beautiful nature. Not recommended to go when it's raining..
beautiful and out off this world. never even thought this would be worth , thank god im wrong this one off the best places to visit , the cable car ride is awesome and out of this world

A beautiful trip out from the big city. Experience can be weather dependent, but we took the ferry out here in winter when it was a bit misty and not too warm, but still had a lovely experience. The island is beautiful, the scenery spectacular with lush, rolling hills and dramatic landscapes. The contrast with the busy districts of the city made this very welcome as a day trip. The harbour where we got off from the ferry had a number of good places to eat with different cuisines, and we took a bus from there to the buddhist monastery with the big statue. The tourist village next to the monastery is terribly tacky and kitsch but has a range of places to eat and a number of services. The cable car ride down to the metro station takes in some beautiful scenery and is worth having to walk through the tourist trap fake village (and the hours of queuing!).

So much to see. This is one of the Islands you should visit when in Hong Kong. There is so much to see and do on the Island. The big Buddha apart this will keep you busy for at least half a day or longer. Plenty places to eat, excellent for just a coffee or lunch. You can reach it by the cable car which I would suggest as the views are spectacular. We went there by cable car and took a taxi back.
A must visit. Great day out here but allow plenty of time if you feel energetic you can climb the 250 steps to the top and the views are amazing from there.
Lantau Island. We all loved it. Need to spend full day out there. Do check out the Po Lin Monastry and Tian Tan Buddha

A holiday highlight.. Our day trip to this island was one of our holiday highlights. The cable car carried us over the mountain with breath-taking views towards the new airport, and it took us to Ngong Ping Village and Big Buddha.

Magnificent views. Wonderful trip, easy to do from Hong Kong. Take the public bus #23 from Tung Chung station. It's a scenic, 45 minute ride up. You can also take the cable car (25mins). It's a fabulous ride with beautiful scenery not to be missed.
Tian Tian Buddha. High up here, you can view the sceneries around the Buddha. It is worth climbing up the steps and catch the views from the top.

Hong Kong from a different angle. This place is absolutely worth a visit, take the cable car to Ngong Ping village, the view along the way is fantastic. Leave the shops to the end. Whilst walking to the Buddha, stop by where you hear nice meditation music (just after the shops) and just enjoy the moment - it'll get you into the perfect mood. Lantau is not just about the Big Buddha though. After visiting it, take a short bus or taxi ride (20/10 min) to Tai O village. Taxi ride is cca 55-60 HKD one way but the bus is also ok and much cheaper (cca 7HKD one way and you can use your Octopus card too). Tai O is a must see. Make sure you read about the history of this little yet amazing fishing village so that you'll understand why and how people live there. You can even get a sneak peek of their life as you walk by as they live it with open doors. I absolutely loved my short time there and you get to see HK from a different angle, no skyscrapers, beautiful nature and absolutely authentic. From Tai O you can go back to Ngong Ping and finish your day with some shopping and by getting a coffee and a free wifi code you can even share these moments with your loved ones back home.Lantau has definitely more to it but I only had a short time and I must say I loved every minute of it.

Amazing!. The trek to the buddah is well worth the wait! We were in HK for a few weeks and decided to check this buddah out finally! Relatives say most HKers haven't even checked out the island. The cable car ride to and from, as well as the 268 steps to the buddah, is a journey you cannot miss!

Don't miss it. We travelled to this island in a cable car and the experience is fantastic. Splendid views on the way from the cable car. The island it self is beautiful and a must see for Hong Kong visitors. Nice restaurants in the island along with the tourist attractions. It hosts a nice village, a monastery and Big Buddha. A whole day is almost necessary to enjoy this place.

Lantua Island via the cable car is a must.... We used the train to Lamma Island then booked a ticket on a glass bottom cable car. Instead of booking a return ticket we opted to take the bus back the train station. The bus ride was very scenic and I would recommend it. Gliding over the mountain and wathcing people hiking on the trail below us was something else.....A definite must see

TOO CROWDED!. I enjoyed the cable ride from Tung Chung. You can purchase roundtrip or single journey tickets (upto you).. We took the crystal floor cable which was bit expensive than the regular one. The only difference is that you get a 360 degrees view of the area.. had to share the cable with 4 other people..Took about 10-15 mins to reach.. The Ngong Ping village was cute but too many stalls.. The Big Buddha was indeed "BIG"..Felt blessed being there but too many tourists..but loved the fact that it was clean.. the view of the island was spectacular... It is worth visiting..
five star island. best place in hong kong to visit very homely.people very friendly and lots of very good restaurants all around the island and also very safe .

Lantau Paradise :). This island of HK is must visit during your stay. Its very different from Kowloon and HK islandyou can easily access it my HK metro and its very fastthe island is so green, with its emerald hills and beautiful baysNgong Ping 360C tour is MUST have in there, we went to the village my a cable car - its 30 min breathtaking journey and you can see all island from the skywe saw from up, that some people walking all over the hills all this long way towards big buddha, its crazy) once arrived to Ngong Ping Village, dont rush to the buddhaenjoy small village shopping, drink coffee in one of the small restaurants, try some traditional staff - its really present place.Po lin monastery is full of great energy holy placeand Big Buddha is really BIG :) on the way down we took a bus - the track is also very nice - you can view beautiful wild beaches and forests.after this things we spent some time in the island, doin shopping, and after had a nice dinner in the town.wonderful, peaceful place with great nature!you have to visit Pink Dolphins also - its a miracle!

Loved visiting Ngong Ping . Loved visiting Tian Tan Buddha and the Po Lin monastery (at Ngong Ping). Worth climbing the 268 steps to get to the Buddha statue with incredible views. Getting the ferry to Lantau island and the cable car down to tung Chung gives you a great mixture of beautiful views. There are a few overpriced shops and cafe/restaurants at Ngong Ping Plateau but I enjoyed the restaurant at the monastery more. If you need to go to the toilet try and avoid the squat toilets near the Buddha and monastery and wait until you get down to the toilets near the cable car which are much cleaner and nicer
Lantau Island. It's a fair distance to travel. The sky train over the water is nice but really, apart from climbing the steps up to the Buddha, it is a bit disappointing there is not that much to see

Worth a second visit.. This was my second time visiting this place. The first time I went it was so foggy that by the time I got up the mountain. I couldn't see the Big Buddha or anything else. It was worth returning to see the Big Buddha and the view from the top. There was also a trail from the bottom of the mountain that will take you to the top. There were several people hiking. It was a gorgeous day I wouldn't mind spending the day hiking up. We took the cable car up but took the bus to Tai O, a small fishing village. This place is also worth a visit.

A real highlight. A place we would have lived to explore given more time. Many walking trails for hikers. Fantastic cable car ride to the top to the Big Buddha, although be prepared to stand in line for extended periods of time during peak hours.

Average experience. Went to see the Big Budha. Took a cable car, wait time was around 15 minutes, and on your way to the big budha, you will go through a village. Dont ever buy those junks sold there, The whole experience was just average, not worth the price and time
Cable car trip. Cable car trip is the highlight of the visit. Go for crystal cabin, the staff normally let's one family per cabin.

Tian Tan Buddha and Po Lin Monastery. We hop on the bus at Lantau island and the environment is so relax and we have visited to the Tian Tan Buddha. It is amazing. You can simply hop on and off on the place you wanted to go. We also viisted to Po Lin Monastery. Better to spend a day over there.
Gian Buddha. We went to Ngong Ping on Lantau by gondola. Excellent place to walk around, go up about 120 steps to reach the Giantt Buddha statue and have lunch at an excellent restaurant there.

Lantau island - Hong Kong. we had an extra day planned to visit Hong Kong,We opted for a conducted tour starting in the afternoon,This included the Lantau island.The weather is unpredictable here so be prepared for rain.Our tour guide was a local from the island and his displeasure of the island being turned into another area with lot of concrete structures was obvious.He also said that all this activity was detrimental to the ecosystem and the peace and quite lovtng people and Monks of the region.The island has many tourist spots ,The important one is the monastery which has a long history ,built in 3 different times.It is very well maintained and beautifully decorated .Photography is allowed only from outside and not inside the sanctum.The area arond has several bronze statues of several important chinese people amidst well laid out gardens .It is a must see place

Take your time. Take your time with this attraction. You *could* do it in half a day, but why would you? Don't be one of those tourists that simple snap and catalogue places without taking time to understand and experience them.Firstly you'll need to get from HK to Lantau. Then to appreciate it fully you'll need to see not only the obvious highlights but also the quieter byways and backstreets. Take the time and it will reward you back.
